story:
Short Summary

My name is Stephen Howard. I am 19 years old. I am a sophomore in KSU and work at an accounting firm in Marietta. I have a passion for engineering and a love of science and politics. I LOVE space, Neil Degrasse Tyon is my hero, and one day I will design the very vessels of our future, 

  • I have developed an idea to solve a simple problem and am working with Davison at Inventionland to create a product to solve it. The problem Identified was that light from low wattage bulbs are not very bright, and appear dim in larger rooms, requiring more light sources to appear the same brightness as other higher wattage lights. To solve this problem I set out to design a lamp that could take these lower wattage bulbs, amplify them to a similar brightness as the higher ones, while remaining small enough to fit in corners or aesthetically pleasing enough to place in the open, and still solve the brightness problem no matter its location within the room. This product I've called the Amplilight is designed to have a surrounding shape of a cube, while the sides reflect a stereo's design of a concave indention that surrounds a smaller convex "lens" design of the lamp. 

  • Understand that this project will set my career path before me. With all of your help, this product will be available to everyone, and I will have achieved a dream of having helped solve a problem for thousands of people. I wish money didn't get in the way of things like this, but this has been a dream of mine for all my life. Maybe if this product is popular I can better afford college, but my only goal right now, realistically, is to help everyone else, and build my own resume' with a successful product licensed to another company for production. 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • So for funding I need at least $1000 to create a successful product to present to a company. I'm not asking for enough to make it myself, just enough to convince a company to produce it. I will retain 100% of the idea but they will have sole rights to production and selling of the product. 
  • If I fail to reach my goal, all of the money will still go to the project, but I am told it is very expensive so it may not be bought by a company if I cannot pay for the entire prototype in time

Risks & Challenges

  • I am a national member of AIAA (American Institute for Astronautics and Aeronautics) and am a Mechanical Engineering Major. So I certainly know the risks involved with this product... The product prototype may cost more money if a design flaw is discovered, or if a company needs to save money somewhere. Unfortunately this is a very common thing, so I promise to always tell you all anything that changes as SOON as it changes. 
  • My plan to solve these challenges is to be open to design changes while not sacrificing the solution to the problem I identified. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Tell anyone you know about the campaign even if you can't contribute. Good luck to you all, and thank you for reading this

story:
Introducing the First Affordable Package of Eco-Friendly Socks 

                                                     Proudly Made in the USA 



We all have seen recycled paper and numerous other products on the market which have been created out of recycled or excess materials and re-purposed. So why not re-purpose cotton for socks?

The process is simple, Eco-friendly and consumes 80% less energy.

This occurs from gathering excess clothing clippings in the manufacturing process of other cotton products which are bundled up, shredded, and re-spun into "New" yarn that would have otherwise ended up in a landfill.

Increasing the demand for recycled cotton has huge benefits which are:

·  It's a Natural Fiber 

·  Reduces Waste in the Landfills 

·  Reduces Demand on Precious Water Resources 

·  Reduces Demand on Energy 

·  Reduces Pollution 

·  Creating and Sustaining the Local Economy

So therefore, I am excited to announce this project. 

RecycledSocks.Com

                                           Reducing Waste to Landills

                     Changing the American Landscape One Pair at a Time!


Samples have been made and the project is ready to Rock and Roll!

The project is starting out with 6 different sizes of the White crew style to hook everyone's feet up.  

As funds are being raised we can begin manufacturing the recycled cotton crew socks.
After the launch more styles will become available.



So Come On!

Have An Impact on Your Wallet and the Environment

Grab Yourself a 5-Pack or For Someone You Know

We all can make a difference one Foot Print at a time. 


Recycled Socks, Socks of a New Generation

Recycled Socks, Always the Right Choice


Risks and challenges

I have been working with our manufacturing partner for the last year to finalize the project. Everything is in place as we are ready for the production phase.

After the campaign ends in 30 days, it's take about 15 days for us to receive the funds.

It's expected to be about a month and half after this campaign ends that I will begin shipping out all the orders.

The only risk is a delay on shipments, but they actually may ship out earlier than expected.

How Can You Help?

After grabbing one of our awesome affordable perks, you can help by inviting your friends, family and peers by sharing our campaign. 

Tell everyone know and help spread the word!

We look forward to reducing the impact on our environment.

Thanks so much!

story:
The idea behind the Ovi Watch is to produce high-quality wooden watches with a touch of nature and design in the best price range possible.

 

 

                                  

 

                                                    

 

 

Some of you may not know that Latvia's number one export is wood and that the country is mostly covered with forests. Our vision is not just to cut the trees down and use them as materials for furniture or for heating, or anything else – our mission is to put some additional value to them, that is why we have created OVi Watches.

OVi Watches are not only high quality, but also super light, which will allow you to wear them on any occasion – either it is on daily basis or at a wedding toasting to your friends’ happiness. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Started by young entrepreneurs and watch enthusiasts Ivo, Zintis and Dāvis, we set out to create a collection of wooden watches based on our passion for design, craftsmanship and timepieces.  Ivo Asns made the first prototype in Liepajas Design and Art College and now we are hoping to take one step closer to YOU by offering OVi watches.

 

 

& The dream has resulted in the first OVi watch collection.

 

 

 

The next step is the awesome crowd funding place called IndieGogo. We have made a working prototype that can change the way we live. All we need is just one more thing – Your SUPPORT!

 

 

 

 

We have designed the watches from scratch using modern tools. Our 3D models later became technical drawings which then were produced in Liepāja Design and Art College. We are not using any manufacturers to produce Ovi watches, and to keep high quality we will produce all of the OVi watches in our home town Liepāja. 

We aim to have a direct approach to our customers. Therefore, we avoided costly intermediaries, distributors and sales personal. The watches will only be sold through our own website and on Indiegogo. This is crucial, as we are trying to sell them for the best price possible.

 

                                   

 

 

 

 

 

1) 42mm casing crafted from natural hardwood

2) Swiss made movement: Ronda, caliber 762 3H

3)  Highly scratch-resistant sapphire crystal glass 

4) 10.5 mm thick case include glass

5) Genuine calf leather strap, which locks inside of the watch

6) Steel waterproof crowns 

7) Stainless steel screws and threads 

8) Case and back is finished with high quality matt varnish

 

For our first collection, we are offering four different materials to choose from

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


From now until the end of Ovi Watch campaign, you can refer your friends to get one Ovi Watch for free (referrals must total $899). Check out our rules here.

 

We need YOU, too! We remind you that Indiegogo will allow us to raise the funds only if we reach our goal. We will try to promote the project in different ways,online and offline, and we hopethat through the use of social media and blogs we can address all traffic here. By sharing the page, promoting the project, publishing pictures with the #oviwatch hashtag You can really contribute to the spread of this fund-raiser. You just have to subscribe in Facebook, Twitter and Instagram to receive the latest news and share them with all your friends and followers.

We have so many ideas for future watch designs and our dream is to become a well-known watch brand in the years to come. Therefore we hope that you would like to be a part of our exciting journey. 

If there is anything you would like to ask, please, post it in the comment section!

And remember!

 

 

 

 

We understand that not all of You are willing to back our campaign, but no worries, here are some other ways You can help!

  • We would be more than thankfull if You could spread the word around Your friends, family, relitives etc. – maybe one of them will like OVi Watches and will be interested in contributing!
  • Ofcourse, don't forget to share/like/follow OVi Watch on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook. Let’s make this not only a project, but  – a movement! By letting others know, You would help us very much!

 

 

 

 

 

Firstly, our inner policy is simple: deliver high quality watches for an acceptable price. 
As we all know, there are a lot of expensive and good looking wood materials, but the problem is combining the best possible materials, that wouldn't skyrocket the price.

Secondly, the time usage in the production process. As OVi watch is new to this market, we are also learning the process of working in a high capacity.
This means our machines will need to get upgrades in a way that is new to us. 
We haven't yet had the chance to get the proper experience in working with upgraded machinery. So, to get the upgrade, we need YOUR help!

 

We would like to thank our families and friends that have supported us on our journey from the start and have made this Indiegogo possible. A special thanks goes out to Liepāja Design and Art College, Kurzemes Biznesa inkubators and our video producers Sense Media (http://www.smedia.lv/) that created the stunning video. We would also like to thank our photograph Edgars Beņislavskis and  graphic designer Rodijs Razmus for creating these super cool pictures for our campaign.

story:
Short Summary

RawWood Shades Co. was founded in 2014 after we saw a market need for high quality, yet affordable wooden sunglasses. After a successful indiegogo campaign for our wooden sunglasses, we have continued to improve and grow over the past year. 

We've taken our knowledge in sustainable fashion into this next step of our business, wood watches. We're stoked about this product, and we know you will be too!

Oh yeah, did we mention that we plant one tree for every single watch (And pair of sunglasses) you order?

  • While we're already established as a company, we need funds to produce this new product on a large scale. We have some watches created, but need help to push this project towards completion, this is where you come in!
  • We are offering two types of watches currently. The Tahoe model, and the Renegade model. Both watches feature are made out of bamboo, and feature a super comfortable leather band.  
  • Due to the bamboo's natural density, they are incredibly light.
  • All of our watches come with a custom RawWood bamboo case!

The Renegade: 

The Tahoe: 



Perks:

We have three levels of backing depending on how early you back the project:
  • Super Early Bird: $40! - Get the lowest price you'll ever get for a Wood Watch by RawWood!
  • Early Bird: $50 - Still way below eventual retail pricing, get here soon for a great price!
  • Wood Watch Indiegogo special pricing: $60 - A discounted rate for all those who back our indiegogo project, get your RawWood Watch before anyone else!
These prices will be cheaper than anything we will offer once our project is complete, so make sure to take advantage of it soon!

Risks & Challenges

As in any new undertaking in a business product, there is inherent risk. We have hoped to minimize this risk by working on the product and creating a solid baseline for success before we begin full consumer production.

We've learned a lot as a new, young business in the growing sustainable fashion field. We know this will help us overcome challenges we will certainly face.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the project via your social networks! 

Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram.

Facebook.com/RawWoodShades

Twitter.com/RawWoodShades

Instagram: @RawWoodShadesCo

story:
Short Summary

Unique Emporium is a retail store designed to sell quality products made by local artisans.  It will provide a brick and mortar location for artisans to sell their products on a regular basis and provide a retail space to direct customers.

What We Need & What You Get

The purpose of this campaign is to raise the start-up funds to open the store.  The retail space has been secured, but displays and fixtures still need to be purchased.  

Not only will you help launch a small business, but you will also help support local artisans.  Plus, there are lots of fun perks that go along with your donation.

The Impact

Unique Emporium is a small business that will help local artisans.  The goal is to have a retail store that will increase the business for local artisans, which is a benefit to the community as a whole.

Risks & Challenges

The main risk in any retail business is product and customers.  The risk of lack of product is mitigated by having a variety of artisans and a waiting list of prospective artisans.  We will be out at the local craft and vendor fairs to recruit new artisans.  Once the store is open (April 2016) and the artisans begin to see a return on their investment, word of mouth will help keep artisans in Unique Emporium.

The second risk is lack of customers.  This risk is mitigated by each artisan using their current customer base to drive business to Unique Emporium.  Each artisan will not only promote their business but by virtue of promoting the store, they will also promote other artisans.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, please, please, please forward the information to your network.  The more people it reaches, the better chance I have of reaching my goal.

story:
Spashionista

My name is Alicia Searcy and I am the Spashionista (short for Spastic Fashionista) Nashville, Tennessee's disabled fashion and style blogger extraordinaire. I was born with Cerebral Palsy and am wheelchair or walker dependent, but that hasn't stopped me from being fashionable. In fact, I think being stylish and caring about one's appearance is a sign of self-respect and approachability. 

For the last four years on my blog, Spashionista.com, I've shared my passion for fashion, style, trends, and a glimpse at life in Nashville while advocating for social awareness and acceptance of people with disabilities. During that time I've befriended so many of Nashville's talented fashion designers, boutique owners, artisans and creatives that fully support the idea of inclusion and body positivity. When I wear their clothing and accessories I am raising awareness that fashion isn't just for young, able-bodied supermodels. It's for all of us. 

Fashion is for Every Body

To that end, I've partnered with Krystle Ramos, who owns vintage clothing boutique Pura Vida Vintage, to co-produce Music City's very first evening of inclusive runway segments featuring male and female models of all ages, races, sizes and abilities. Fashion is for Every Body will take place on Saturday, September 10th at 6pm at abrasiveMedia in Nashville. Local designers Evan Gray, Catland Forever Couture, Amanda Valentine, Nashville Fashion Forward Fund Recipient Eric Adler, Ola Mai, Black by Maria Silver will show some of their iconic Nashville clothing. Clothing from Pura Vida Vintage and Opium Vintage will also be featured, and John Thielman, Andrés Bustamante and ALTER UR EGO are presenting their debut collections.  Likewise, we have twenty models from age 18 to 50+, tiny to voluptuous, and about a third use mobility aids. They are excited to be a part of this project, as are the designers - some of them having shown just last week at Nashville Fashion Week 2016. 
Guests will enjoy light bites and a signature cocktail as well as a documentary which will play during changing breaks about how the show's participants view their contribution to fashion and inclusion in today's Nashville. The evening will conclude with a pop-up shopping event featuring clothing by the show's designers and boutiques and any artwork displayed on the walls of abrasiveMedia. The inaugural Fashion is for Every Body will pay tribute to David Bowie's iconic influence on fashion, style, and self-acceptance.
Please help us to show the world that, when it comes to fashion and style, we all matter and join us as we walk or roll down the runway!

Perk #1: Ladies' White V-Neck Short-Sleeve Graphic Tee in sizes S-XXXL

Help Make This Show a Reality

Fashion shows are usually involved and expensive productions. We are fortunate to have Empower Tn - an organization dedicated to cultivating a barrier-free community where people with disabilities are valued equally and participate fully - assisting us in promoting the event. Likewise, everyone involved in the show is volunteering their time without payment. But we still have to pay for the venue, the food and drink, photo and video screens, chair rentals, programs, merchandise and, most importantly, lighting the runway. Every penny we collect beyond Indiegogo's fee will go towards funding Fashion is for Every Body. Any money we receive in excess of our needs will go towards next year's show. This is a not-for-profit venture.

In Return for Your Donation

We have some great, affordable perks. Donors can choose from a T-Shirt, Poster, Bracelet, Advanced Ticket, Program Sponsorship or Step-and-Repeat Sponsorship. Numerous Program Ad Packages are also available.

Perk #2: Limited Edition Goblin Queen Print by Alicia Searcy

Perk #3: Spashionista Logo Silver-Tone Bracelet by Bessie May & Co

Please Join Us for the Show or Share Our Story

Using Indiegogo's share tools. Follow us on our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram  pages. Strike your best pose and share your photos and thoughts about fashion and style using the hashtag: #fashionisforeverybody.
story_txt:
Spashionista 

My name is Alicia Searcy and I am the Spashionista (short for Spastic Fashionista) Nashville, Tennessee's disabled fashion and style blogger extraordinaire. I was born with Cerebral Palsy and am wheelchair or walker dependent, but that hasn't stopped me from being fashionable. In fact, I think being stylish and caring about one's appearance is a sign of self-respect and approachability. 
For the last four years on my blog, Spashionista.com, I've shared my passion for fashion, style, trends, and a glimpse at life in Nashville while advocating for social awareness and acceptance of people with disabilities. During that time I've befriended so many of Nashville's talented fashion designers, boutique owners, artisans and creatives that fully support the idea of inclusion and body positivity. When I wear their clothing and accessories I am raising awareness that fashion isn't just for young, able-bodied supermodels. It's for all of us. 



Fashion is for Every Body
To that end, I've partnered with Krystle Ramos, who owns vintage clothing boutique Pura Vida Vintage, to co-produce Music City's very first evening of inclusive runway segments featuring male and female models of all ages, races, sizes and abilities. Fashion is for Every Body will take place on Saturday, September 10th at 6pm at abrasiveMedia in Nashville. Local designers Evan Gray, Catland Forever Couture, Amanda Valentine, Nashville Fashion Forward Fund Recipient Eric Adler, Ola Mai, Black by Maria Silver will show some of their iconic Nashville clothing. Clothing from Pura Vida Vintage and Opium Vintage will also be featured, and John Thielman, Andrés Bustamante and ALTER UR EGO are presenting their debut collections.  Likewise, we have twenty models from age 18 to 50+, tiny to voluptuous, and about a third use mobility aids. They are excited to be a part of this project, as are the designers - some of them having shown just last week at Nashville Fashion Week 2016. 
Guests will enjoy light bites and a signature cocktail as well as a documentary which will play during changing breaks about how the show's participants view their contribution to fashion and inclusion in today's Nashville. The evening will conclude with a pop-up shopping event featuring clothing by the show's designers and boutiques and any artwork displayed on the walls of abrasiveMedia. The inaugural Fashion is for Every Body will pay tribute to David Bowie's iconic influence on fashion, style, and self-acceptance.
Please help us to show the world that, when it comes to fashion and style, we all matter and join us as we walk or roll down the runway!


Perk #1: Ladies' White V-Neck Short-Sleeve Graphic Tee in sizes S-XXXL

Help Make This Show a Reality
Fashion shows are usually involved and expensive productions. We are fortunate to have Empower Tn - an organization dedicated to cultivating a barrier-free community where people with disabilities are valued equally and participate fully - assisting us in promoting the event. Likewise, everyone involved in the show is volunteering their time without payment. But we still have to pay for the venue, the food and drink, photo and video screens, chair rentals, programs, merchandise and, most importantly, lighting the runway. Every penny we collect beyond Indiegogo's fee will go towards funding Fashion is for Every Body. Any money we receive in excess of our needs will go towards next year's show. This is a not-for-profit venture.   In Return for Your Donation
We have some great, affordable perks. Donors can choose from a T-Shirt, Poster, Bracelet, Advanced Ticket, Program Sponsorship or Step-and-Repeat Sponsorship. Numerous Program Ad Packages are also available.


Perk #2: Limited Edition Goblin Queen Print by Alicia Searcy



Perk #3: Spashionista Logo Silver-Tone Bracelet by Bessie May & Co
 Please Join Us for the Show or Share Our Story
 Using Indiegogo's share tools. Follow us on our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram  pages. Strike your best pose and share your photos and thoughts about fashion and style using the hashtag: #fashionisforeverybody.

story:
My name is Julia Boikova and I am a fashion designer, who has only just started her brand two seasons ago. I have graduated from London College of Fashion a couple of years back and now I am pursuing my dream of designing and producing kick ass clothes ;)  I have been making clothes since the age of 13 and there is nothing I love more! With my first two seasons I have gotten into digitally printed textiles, all my  prints are unique and designed by me. Better than words check out my work on www.juliaboikova.com I have to say, so far it has been going very very well and this is why I am really pushing it to make it happen with the help of indiegogo platform and of course you are  taking the biggest part in it! 

My campaign on indiegogo is to help me to take my work onto a new level where I can hire people to help me to expand (marketing and production), as well as getting proper tags and wrapping materials in place. I will also be able to introduce better prices for fall collection - bulk orders make big difference in price! And even if I wont get the full amount desired, it will all go towards expanding and will still help a lot ( my enthusiasm has a good base, I have been very busy with making it all work lately!)!  

Your contribution will make huge impact on my brand. Right now I am lacking just this support from really making it happen! Your support will of course be rewarded! I am offering you some of the pieces from my summer collection in exchange for your help, it works just the same way as online shop - take your pick and decide on the amount of contribution (or other way round)

Below you will find more about inspiration for the new collection and what it is made of!

                                                          SUMMER 2016

There are two inspirations behind this collection. First one is Blood and Milk - my graduate collection at college - and this is a more commercial version of it! 

The print has been photographed in high resolution and then printed on fabric, it is the blood pored into the milk creating beautiful unique patters you wont find anywhere else! We really enjoyed shooting it, as it really is very beautiful although a bit creepy in a way! 

 I also wanted to add something new to this collection and took another photography based print of a cracked paint on the wall. I have taken photos of the wall of the sewing factory , the one I used to work at in summer while at school, this factory doesn't exist any longer and it is a tribute in a way. 

The garments are mostly in white/light color prints, it is much easier to wear it in the summer heat! There are also pieces  that are made of 100% cotton, with cotton lining, it will definitely give you extra comfort in the blazing sun! 

More over the t-shirts, beside being 100% cotton, amazing light weight, are also unisex! So guys don't complain I don't do men's wear (at least not yet).The range above and below is all 100% cotton.   

Double layer skirt is a skirt with two layers of canvas type fabric - white outer part with the slit  and the second layer  much shorter with cracked paint print

Sleeveless long Tee is also super dress for the beach as it is very light and comfy with two slits on the sides ( 100% cotton jersey) I also really like it with black skinny jeans ( that for English summer ;) 

Mini skirt is made of fabric with cracked paint print on white canvas type fabric and has two pockets. 

There are also few elegant pieces, and although some are made of crepe polyester fabric,  they are super nice to wear - don't let the word "polyester" to scare you. I used very nice  slightly sheer fabric and all of them are lined, somehow it feels nice and pleasant  to the skin. 

The drape sleeve top has a little original black strap detail on the sleeve.

Two dresses below are perfect for casual as well as elegant (depending on the shoes) look. Both lined, the cotton number on the right also sports couple of side pockets. 

These two are a little more special, very girly and super light. Also made with crepe polyester fabric and both lined. Hard to say they are my favorite as I do love everything I design, but my heart melts a little when I wear these two   <3


All the garments are machine washable (apart from silk frame finish dress). If you decide to go ahead and support me, your rewards will be delivered to you between 1st and 15th of July (some delays might occur only due to delivery service) . Should you have any questions or would like close-up photos of the garments please feel free to email me on julia@juliaboikova.com 

If you love what I do, but don't have the funds, you would also really help me by sharing it with your friends and family ! 

On this note have a good day peeps, and who knows may be I have inspired you to create something of your dreams too! ;)

story:
The benefits or our finest Silk- chiffon:

Our fabric is the 1´st production line silk-chiffon, which is bought from finest fabric producers in Europe. Our fabric is the most hypoallergenic of all fabrics. An All-climate material, which is comfortably cool when temperatures rise. Its natural temperature-regulating properties give our fabric this paradoxical ability to cool and warm simultaneously. Our dresses thus outperform other fabrics in summer. Fabric is also highly absorbent and dries quickly. It can absorb up to 30% of its weight in moisture without feeling damp. Our dress silk-chiffon fabric will absorb perspiration while letting your skin breathe. In spite of dress delicate appearance, it is relatively robust and its smooth surface resists soil and odors well


                              





 




                                         

                      

Final selection of colors and patterns to choose from, will be sent to each backer straight after the end of our campaign. Don't worry, the variety will be wide. 


                    





                                          


                  

 
                            

    

Check us out on: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest

story:
Let me introduce myself.


My name is Pete Hopkins and I am an aspiring fashion photographer and BFA student of Photography at the Academy of Art University. I am also the founder of The Valencia Street Review, a unique fashion/art/style blog based in San Francisco. I am incredibly focused and passionate about fashion photography and it shows in my work. 

Twice a year, I travel on my own to New York Fashion Week to photograph backstage, runway, and street style fashion. My close-up and narrative style has gained me intimate access to the fashion world. I've worked side by side with designers, stylists, models, and production teams and I see firsthand the ups and downs in the intensely competitive world of high fashion.

In addition, my work has been featured in People.com, Detail.com, and the AAU's 180 Magazine as well as spotlighting designer's works here and abroad. My next goal is to cover Fashion Month in it's entirety and create a photo book entitled, "NEW YORK, LONDON, MILAN, PARIS, ME.". This is where I need your help. 

  

  


So What Is My Project? 

My goal is to create a book that shines the spotlight on my love for fashion. I plan to cover Fashion Month, from the runway to the street, in New York, London, Milan and Paris, from a distinctly insider's point of view. The story I want to tell is that fashion is more than just looking pretty. It is a way of affirming our individuality and being a part of the collective at the same time. It is our statement to one another - "This is me. I am unique AND I belong." This will manifest into a beautiful volume of work, depicting the world of fashion from a fine art photographer's perspective.


  



How Do You Participate?

Your contributions will aide me in creating a work of art that you and everyone you know will want. To do this, I need at least $12,000 and the breakdown of expenses is really simple: transportation, visa(s), food and lodging, press passes, gear and production costs, and overhead costs here at home. Let’s not forget Indiegogo’s cut, and a portion is budgeted for unseen expenses or emergencies.


Your Impact

1. You will have a direct hand in the book’s creation. I will include your name on the contributor's page in the book, as a bonus for your generosity. If that's not enough, I'm offering a bunch of special gifts for you (look right! >>>) in appreciation for joining the campaign.

2. Your support will aide me in my goal of obtaining a degree at the Academy of Art. My ongoing thesis is twofold. One part being a journalistic account of style and fashion around the globe and the other part being a purely aesthetic editorial of the same, yet from a fine art perspective.

3. You will be helping me achieve my lifelong dream of becoming an established fashion photographer. Your support will be strengthen my portfolio, support my ongoing education and further my professional career.



My Story.

Up until 6 ½ years ago, I had little aspirations of becoming a photographer. I didn't even know how to operate a camera. I was in the grips of a serious drug and alcohol addiction, unemployed and frequently homeless. A troubled childhood led me to escape through sex, drugs and rock & roll. To be honest, it worked for along time, until it just stopped working. Luckily, I was introduced to an exceptional recovery program and with the help of friends and family, I got clean and sober. Then I got honest with myself. I realized that I had sacrificed not only my health and security for my addictions, but also most of my goals. One of those was being a fashion photographer.


As a child, I was fascinated with images of the fashion world. I would spend hours looking through catalogs and magazines, dreaming of being a model and living in “exotic, far away places.” Moreover, I was mesmerized by the works of Richard Avedon and Annie Leibowitz. I envied not only their talent behind the lens, but their access to a world of glamour and style.




My desire to be a model has subsided, but my need to create images has amplified. I’m constantly studying and honing my skills in order to create the images I saw growing up and I'm forever asking questions about photography or fashion to anyone who will listen. Those who knows me well can attest to this. Seriously! I can go on and on, to a fault! It’s because now I realize that not everyone gets a chance to live their dream and certainly fewer get a second chance. For that I am truly grateful. So, no. I will probably never stop asking questions. And for this fault, I am also incredibly lucky.


I feel compelled to share this side of me so I may hopefully inspire others to remember their own dreams and pursue them by any means necessary. I am a true lover of fashion and I hope my work reflects that love. My daily path may sometimes vary, but my life's work is focused: the pursuit of fashion through photography.


The Challenges

The Events: You may be asking "How are you going to get into all the shows? Do you know everyone?" Not everyone, but I've got my ways. I reach out to industry officials, friends, family and colleagues and talk to everyone I meet about the best locations to shoot and the coolest events to attend. I spend equal time talking with strangers outside of the shows while taking photographs.

The Road: In my previous life, I was a drummer in a rock and roll band, so I know all about life on the road. I've experienced missed flights and angry customs agents, wrong directions, bad weather, sleeping on couches or no sleep at all. I've gotten sick, lost gear, been eaten alive by insects and have done a whole lot of waiting. Challenges are unavoidable and I've learned how to survive them.

Image Logistics and Production: I curate a style blog and I do all my own editing and archiving as I travel from city to city. For a campaign of this size, I will be upgrading my gear and boosting my editing capabilities. I will be processing all my work in state of the art labs to create the highest quality book that everyone will want on their coffee table.



Other Ways You Can Help

Alternative Support: Ideally, everything will be covered by your cash contributions. If I don't reach my goal of $12,000 (or more!), I will graciously make the most out of what I receive, but alternatives such as shared lodging, passes and invitations to shows, and covering expenses here at home would be most welcome. Food is plentiful and I rarely go hungry. Besides, this is fashion right? Nobody eats! JUST KIDDING! Send me all the care packages you like. I am very fond of peanut butter!

Word of Mouth: Just as important as contributing funds to the campaign is spreading the word about the project. Please share on social media, email and text others, tell a friend, let everyone you know about this project! You can follow along with my progress by liking my social media pages on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and by reading the dailies on my blog, www.thevsr.com. Don't forget to use Indiegogo's social media sharing tools after you make your donation.

*FOR EXCLUSIVE PRESS COVERAGE - SEND INQUIRIES TO ME AT PETEFHOPKINS@GMAIL.COM



Gratitude

One of the best pieces of advice I ever received was from Catherine Schuller. A former Ford model, plus size advocate, promoter and dear friend (who later hired me to cover her bi-annual runway production "Runway the Real Way"). She told me, "Pete, if you want to achieve, if you want success, the most important thing is to INCLUDE YOURSELF!" I have applied these words to my own life with great results.

For instance, my first trip to New York as a photographer was to cover "Hearst Fashion Hack" held at Hearst Tower in Manhattan. I thought I was going to shoot fashionistas, but instead I was surrounded by engineers building fashion apps. Whoops! I'll admit that I'm a bit of a computer geek myself, but my plan was to cover NYFW, not a tech convention! 


Not to be discouraged, I finished my assignment and then walked seven blocks in a blizzard to Lincoln Center. I had no credentials nor connections, but I had come too far to give up! As luck would have it, I walked right in. I was awestruck and slack-jawed to be sure, but I snapped out of it quick in fear of being tossed out. With Catherine's words in my ears I started shooting, and enjoyed every minute of it.

The next day, I recounted my story to fashion reporter/guru Michael Quintanilla, and he assured me that I was very lucky indeed and opportunities like that don't happen all the time. He invited me to attend the Vivienne Tam and Ralph Rucci shows and I happily accepted. I shot the runway, went backstage, met the designers and was invited a number of other shows and events that week. From that moment on, I have always "included myself". Thanks Cat!



I would like to thank you all for your time and consideration and for participating in my project. I'm very happy that you are on-board with what I promise will be an amazingly successful adventure. - P.

Pete Hopkins was born and raised in California and is currently studying Fashion and Photography at the Academy of Art University in San Francisco.

His works can be seen at www.petefhopkins.com and his ongoing style blog, www.thevsr.com


Photo by Chris Lentz

You can follow along with my progress by liking my social media pages on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and by reading the dailies on my blog, www.thevsr.com. Don't forget to use Indiegogo's social media sharing tools after you make your donation.
*FOR EXCLUSIVE PRESS COVERAGE - SEND INQUIRIES TO ME AT PETEFHOPKINS@GMAIL.COM



Gratitude

One of the best pieces of advice I ever received was from Catherine Schuller. A former Ford model, plus size advocate, promoter and dear friend (who later hired me to cover her bi-annual runway production "Runway the Real Way"). She told me, "Pete, if you want to achieve, if you want success, the most important thing is to INCLUDE YOURSELF!" I have applied these words to my own life with great results.

For instance, my first trip to New York as a photographer was to cover "Hearst Fashion Hack" held at Hearst Tower in Manhattan. I thought I was going to shoot fashionistas, but instead I was surrounded by engineers building fashion apps. Whoops! I'll admit that I'm a bit of a computer geek myself, but my plan was to cover NYFW, not a tech convention! 



Not to be discouraged, I finished my assignment and then walked seven blocks in a blizzard to Lincoln Center. I had no credentials nor connections, but I had come too far to give up! As luck would have it, I walked right in. I was awestruck and slack-jawed to be sure, but I snapped out of it quick in fear of being tossed out. With Catherine's words in my ears I started shooting, and enjoyed every minute of it.

The next day, I recounted my story to fashion reporter/guru Michael Quintanilla, and he assured me that I was very lucky indeed and opportunities like that don't happen all the time. He invited me to attend the Vivienne Tam and Ralph Rucci shows and I happily accepted. I shot the runway, went backstage, met the designers and was invited a number of other shows and events that week. From that moment on, I have always "included myself". Thanks Cat!










I would like to thank you all for your time and consideration and for participating in my project. I'm very happy that you are on-board with what I promise will be an amazingly successful adventure. - P.
Pete Hopkins was born and raised in California and is currently studying Fashion and Photography at the Academy of Art University in San Francisco.
His works can be seen at www.petefhopkins.com and his ongoing style blog, www.thevsr.com



Photo by Chris Lentz

story:
The Box & The Product

The box,
Quality gift box with a synthetic leather inlay.
 We have also added a small envelope the size of a business card to all the gift boxes. Inside the envelope is a little white piece of paper where you can write your wishes. We kept it small so it doesn`t look bad if you are just writing a few words.
 The bracelets are made of genuine leather and stainless steel with a very secure fastening system. The White Walkers bracelet has a strong magnet clasp and CRANIUM is adjustable.


What We Need & What you get

How much?

  • We need about £3000 to place the first order for the bracelets and for the gift boxes and to also generate cash flow so we can launch our future products. The more we raise the more products we will launch.
What do you get in return?
  • We have set up packages of 1, 2,3 or 5 bracelets all delivered in the Savoir London gift box in exchange for your support. All our backers will benefit from our pre-launch discounted price as a way of thanking you.


What else?
  • All our backers will also receive a lifetime 15% OFF coupon for all the products we will launch in the future on our website.
  • We have already put a deposit down for the gift boxes and we will soon pay a deposit for the bracelets.

Why your support is important?

  •  The money we will raise we will use to introduce our first bracelet collection to the market and continue launching other interesting gifts we have been working on.
  •  We would also love your feedback about our product, our packaging and how we can continue to create the great products.

Risks & Challenges

  • We have negotiated production and delivery times with our suppliers and all the orders should be received by our backers in 30-40 days after the campaign ends. If the delivery time changes in any way we will announce everyone by email.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Encouragement works for anyone but also constructive criticism so feel free to send me your feedback, ideas and any suggestions you may have, even if you decide not to support our cause. 

Follow us on social media facebook/instagram/pintrest @savoirlondon 

or visit our website www.savoirlondon.com

REFUNDS:

If by any chance you are not satisfied with our product you have 30 days to return it for a full refund.

story:
What inspired me to get here you may ask? Well... a few broken propellers months ago and my 3D printer.

Still confused? Don't be, if you love drones and you are tired of constantly breaking your propellers and buying new ones choosing from a limited range, I have created a simple solution to allow you to have fun customising your propellers.

Seeing my drone flying around with my own designed 3D printed propellers I just knew I had to share.

I am fortunate to have the perfect combination of skills to make it happen - the result for you is a super easy template, that allows you to create your own custom propellers.


All the propellers in the photo below are 3D printed.



5 reasons why 3D print your propellers

  1. Replace broken propellers


  2. Get new custom propellers within hours (small ones in minutes!)
  3. Replace existing propellers (see making of 30 mm propellers below)

  4. Customise propellers to your liking (see making of a 5 in propeller below)

  5. Filament based colour choice

Rewards

A super easy to use template files designed for FDM 3D printing.

  • Customise simply by moving sliders
  • Straight forward export of your design (File>Export>STL)
  • Within Blender – Blender is free
  • A brief tutorial included with each template
  • See how easy it is below - just pick a parameter and move the slider
To create a propeller you just have to select a parameter you want to modify and move the slider. In regards to dimensions, use the on screen overlay rulers for the visual reference.
Do not worry, no actual Blender modelling skills are required!


The templates are created in Blender as it is a free open-source software. In addition to that it is an excellent solution to create this slider based control system which allows your imagination/design to go wild. This gives you a lot of freedom, so do not abuse it - please do a visual check to not go over your printers self-support angle (that is usually 45 degrees or less for FDM 3D printers).


Each template will include a brief tutorial on how to use it and how to go about the pitch angle and the shape of the particular propeller.


Guaranteed reward :)

You are guaranteed to get what you see in the videos above – Parallel propeller template Alpha (as-is)


              



1 minimal requirement

  1. A device running Blender - Blender is free
When using Shapeways to print your propellers.


3 recommended requirements

  1. A device running Blender - Blender is free
  2. 3D printer
  3. 3D printing skills
When printing propellers using your own single material FDM 3D printer.

Stretch goal elections

You are in control to choose your favourite candidate – your votes will determinate the order in which the Stretch goals get unlocked.




Bow propeller template

The Bow propeller is fully self-supported and printable using a single material FDM 3D printer.


Folding propeller template

The Folding propeller is fully self-supported and printable using a single material FDM 3D printer.


T-style (3 holes) split propeller template

The T-style (3 holes) split propeller is fully self-supported and printable using a single material FDM 3D printer.


Split propeller template

The Split propeller is fully self-supported and printable using a single material FDM 3D printer.


Supported propeller template

The Supported propeller is meant to be printed using a printer which has the support material capability.

3+ supported propeller template

The 3+ supported propeller is meant to be printed using a printer which has the support material capability.



3D propeller template

The 3D propeller is fully self-supported and printable using a single material FDM 3D printer.


Variable pitch propeller template

The Variable pitch propeller is almost fully self-supported and printable using a single material FDM 3D printer.




Happy flying!

As always with the crowdfunding campaigns – you sharing this campaign on your favourite social media, and letting the friends (who you know are into 3D printing and drones) know, will determine how many stretch goals you will get.

Thank you for your interest in 3D printing your very own propellers!






Technicalities

Stretch goal delivery

I will be releasing the unlocked Stretch goal propellers as Beta and implementing your feedback in the 2nd/Final release in February.

  • The red goals are unlocked
  • The white goal is the next in line
  • The grey goals are yet to be unlocked

I am full-time employed and developing products in my free time. I will put my free time activates aside to focus on these deliverables and do my best to deliver sooner than the dates indicated above.


Design process

I will be using the existing propellers as a design guide where available, as I did with the Parallel propeller template.

The black propeller above is 3D printed using the white ones as guides.

The red propeller above is 3D printed using the other two as guides.


Suggest a new Stretch goal

Please feel free to suggest any other stretch goals to add such as FDM 3D printing course, Design for 3D printing course, Blender modelling fundamentals course etc.

Note that I will add stretch goals such as Propeller template designing course only after all the other stretch goals are unlocked.


Issues

I will design the templates so that they are optimised for self-supported FDM 3D printing, as you can see done with the Parallel propeller template.

By the time I get to work on the 2nd/Finial release of the unlocked stretch goals there should be enough of your feedback to create a great set of propellers’ templates.


Possibilities and limitations

Minimal size

The minimal size of a propeller is limited by the resolution of your printer. I successfully printed 21mm short and single extrusion width (0,4mm on my FDM 3D printer) thin blade propellers for my CX-Stars Nano Quadcopter.

Blade thinness

I used Slic3r to create the G-code of a single extrusion width thin blades.


I tried Cura as well, but it seems that it cannot create a G-code of a single extrusion width thin features (correct me if I missed the setting). Instead it forces a closed loop around the perimeter so 2 extrusion width thin feature is the thinnest you can get using Cura.

Maximal size

The maximal size is capped at 5 inches (class 250 drones) due to the concerns of structural integrity of FDM 3D prints.
If you have another opinion/concern, such as "I do not want any size capping even if there are concerns", please let me know. At the end of the day these templates are for you so you should be able to choose.
I have successfully printed 21 mm propellers for CX-Stars Nano Quadcopter and 5 inch propellers for class 250 quadcopters. As closer you are to 5 inches as physically easier it will be to remove the brim and balance the propeller.


Pitch angle and shape

In my opinion the shape/pitch angle is the most sensitive on the propellers for the tiny drones (the ones I tested). The reason being that there is not much reserve of power in these tiny motors.

For example, I started with the so called 3D propeller geometry as it is nice and flat - easy to model. The result was motors stalling and/or drone not being able to lift off the ground when used on the CX drones. At the same time these flat shaped 3D propellers are functioning great on bigger more powerful drones.

As you can see in the videos above you can print even the 21 mm small propellers with no problems using these templates. Please follow the tutorials included with the propeller template.

The automatic pitch angle and shape optimisation is not in the scope of this project!

The principles of a propeller’s pitch angle and shape are described in this awesome blog post Props to you...Props to us all ! by Rob Nielsen.

Quick tips

  • Start by using an existing propeller as a guide
  • Use the tutorials included with each propeller template


Balance your propellers

Follow the same propeller balancing rules as you usually would/must. A great balancing video tutorial How to balance a prop for FPV to help remove video 'wobbles' by Painless360.


Troubleshooting

The self-support angle of your printer

Always remember to keep all the features of the propeller below your maximal printer’s self-support angle. For FDM 3D printers that is usually 45° and less.

This is the reason why the hole shape is a square standing on its corner.

In fact, self-support angle requirement is the reason why these propellers (except the Supported and 3+ supported) will be printed in this unique orientation - on their side.

Insufficient adhesion

3D printing skill teaching is not in the scope of this project!

An example of the insufficient adhesion.

Quick tips

Follow the usual adhesion improvement steps for your printer.

For my FDM 3D printer those are:

  • Printing one propeller at the time
  • Application of glue on the removable print platform using a glue stick and then spreading if evenly using a bit of water
  • Inclusion of the Brim in your slicing strategy
  • Reduction of the 1st layer’s speed to 10% (It might take half of the total print time to print the 1st layer but it will be firmly stuck to the print bed. Also the extrusion nozzle will not peal of the already extruded filament because it moves so slow that it just melts the obstacles instead of colliding with them)

Motors stalling

An example of the motors stalling.

Please improve the shape and/or pith angle of your propeller to reduce drag or try replicating the original propeller to resolve.

Not enough lift

Can move and steer but no flight… Hovercraft.

An example of not enough lift.

Please improve the shape and/or pith angle of your propeller or try replicating the original propeller to resolve.

Ground effect

Lift just enough for ground effect flight… Ekranoplan/ground effect vehicle.

An example of the ground effect.

Please improve the shape and/or pith angle of your propeller to resolve or try replicating the original propeller.


Caution

I take no responsibility on structural integrity of the propellers 3D printed using these templates.

Please, use the industry standard protective eye-wear when using the propellers!

Please go easy when pushing on the 3D printed propellers on the drones with the push on type of propellers. I managed to damage the shafts/motors of my CX-10A Micro Quadcopter after few months of intensively pushing on (sometimes with an excessive force) and pulling off the propellers. If your drone uses the bolted on propellers you are safe in this regard.

story:
In a nutshell:

eskini's modular fashion looks awesome, is on-trend, it's patent-protected, and reduces waste.

 

  • My name is Erin Spaulding. I'm the owner and founder of the eskini brand and it's holding company. I'm also a valuation professional, I value whole companies as well as their specific brands, patents, trademarks and other intangible assets. I did not venture into the super-saturated industry of fashion until I was able to clearly define eskini's unique value-add and offer protection on our collective investment.
  • Like most women age 18-35, I'm very interested in and influenced by fashion as a consumer. Fashion, by market forces we ourselves create, is necessarily obsessed with newness, and responsible for more pollution and waste than any other industry except OIL.
  • I built eskini brand on a modular platform, with styles that reduce waste by allowing existing styles/sku's to be infinitely revitalized/reinvented/re-customized with new accessory straps. 
  • Fashion is also a brutal business of copy-catting and idea theft. eskini's uniquely distinguishable strap (hooked at both ends) is also patent protected in its application to wearables. We can't be copied. Competitive commercial sale of this "technology" must be licensed from eskini.
  • Seed funding and professional contributions for the brand, patents, product development and production has been sourced from myself, my family and my close friends.
  • I have also found that as a direct retailer, my small team and I can facilitate the communication of our product's benefits more passionately and effectively. We are now retailing exclusively from eskini.com. This direct to customer model gives us direct access to the end user - we send followup emails requesting simple click-option feedback - and our customers get much better prices (no keystone markup). 

What We Need & What You Get

Now in early revenue stage, selling our eskiniMOD swimwear, lounge wear and accessories online at eskini.com, we need to gain traction and awareness for the innovative modular benefits by focusing outside investment in content-creation, social media, paid advertising and PR outreach:

  • Content: photo & video, used across social media channels (Budget: $1000/mo). We allocated 15% vesting over 3 years to a production company who produces our video content at no charge. Content expense only includes talent, location permits and props, if needed.
  • Social Media: a freelance social media manager handles posts, engagement and interaction with followers. (Budget: $500/mo)
  • Paid Advertising: Minimum budget for Google AdWords and Facebook Ads on an optimized cost-per-click basis (Budget: $600/mo). With premium video content, online commercial ads are additional. (Budget: $800)
  • Press Outreach: generating interest - inform editors and influencers to get them excited about something new and noteworthy in fashion. Most PR agencies charge a minimum monthly retainer of $2500 to $5000 for small brands. We work with freelancers in the editorial space who work on an hourly basis. (Budget: $1000/mo)
  • For your involvement, we want to thank you. From a simple mention on eskini.com to a gift card for someone you love, all perks come with a great story about how you helped innovation thrive and the fashion industry (one of the world’s worst offenders) become less wasteful! Don't forget to mention #eskiniGOGO when you contribute.
  • Our focus is primarily on generating awareness for the innovation and it’s benefits. This alone should benefit sales efforts. But if we raise more than our goal, we will allocate funds to SEO efforts which can optimize our click-through conversion metrics for sales. If we don't reach our entire goal, we will focus funds on advertising to gain awareness, as well as product development as feedback is offered.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Many people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about eskini's campaign. We'll see your efforts when you use #eskiniGOGO when spreading the word via Instagram, Twitter and Facebook.
  • Contact us (info@eskini.com) if you want to get involved in other ways or give us feedback. We’d sincerely love to hear from you!

Like most women age 18-35, I'm very interested in and influenced by fashion as a consumer. Fashion, by market forces we ourselves create, is necessarily obsessed with newness, and responsible for more pollution and waste than any other industry except OIL.
I built eskini brand on a modular platform, with styles that reduce waste by allowing existing styles/sku's to be infinitely revitalized/reinvented/re-customized with new accessory straps. 
Fashion is also a brutal business of copy-catting and idea theft. eskini's uniquely distinguishable strap (hooked at both ends) is also patent protected in its application to wearables. We can't be copied. Competitive commercial sale of this "technology" must be licensed from eskini.
Seed funding and professional contributions for the brand, patents, product development and production has been sourced from myself, my family and my close friends.
I have also found that as a direct retailer, my small team and I can facilitate the communication of our product's benefits more passionately and effectively. We are now retailing exclusively from eskini.com. This direct to customer model gives us direct access to the end user - we send followup emails requesting simple click-option feedback - and our customers get much better prices (no keystone markup). 



What We Need & What You Get
Now in early revenue stage, selling our eskiniMOD swimwear, lounge wear and accessories online at eskini.com, we need to gain traction and awareness for the innovative modular benefits by focusing outside investment in content-creation, social media, paid advertising and PR outreach:

Content: photo & video, used across social media channels (Budget: $1000/mo). We allocated 15% vesting over 3 years to a production company who produces our video content at no charge. Content expense only includes talent, location permits and props, if needed.
Social Media: a freelance social media manager handles posts, engagement and interaction with followers. (Budget: $500/mo)
Paid Advertising: Minimum budget for Google AdWords and Facebook Ads on an optimized cost-per-click basis (Budget: $600/mo). With premium video content, online commercial ads are additional. (Budget: $800)
Press Outreach: generating interest - inform editors and influencers to get them excited about something new and noteworthy in fashion. Most PR agencies charge a minimum monthly retainer of $2500 to $5000 for small brands. We work with freelancers in the editorial space who work on an hourly basis. (Budget: $1000/mo)
For your involvement, we want to thank you. From a simple mention on eskini.com to a gift card for someone you love, all perks come with a great story about how you helped innovation thrive and the fashion industry (one of the world’s worst offenders) become less wasteful! Don't forget to mention #eskiniGOGO when you contribute.
Our focus is primarily on generating awareness for the innovation and it’s benefits. This alone should benefit sales efforts. But if we raise more than our goal, we will allocate funds to SEO efforts which can optimize our click-through conversion metrics for sales. If we don't reach our entire goal, we will focus funds on advertising to gain awareness, as well as product development as feedback is offered.


 

Other Ways You Can Help
Many people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Help us get the word out and make some noise about eskini's campaign. We'll see your efforts when you use #eskiniGOGO when spreading the word via Instagram, Twitter and Facebook.
Contact us (info@eskini.com) if you want to get involved in other ways or give us feedback. We’d sincerely love to hear from you!

story:
TRIBE: The STORY

Locally Designed. Globally Inspired. For a Greater Purpose.

TRIBE is a global, socially conscious fashion line that was created in Denver—but with a desire to impact the world. Envisioned and dreamed into life by Rebecca Taylor (fashion designer) and Sarah Hidey (international development consultant)—two good friends with a common vision of empowering women—TRIBE has a mission to provide opportunities to women around the world through the provision of job skills and ethical employment in the fashion industry. TRIBE plans to partner with fair-trade nonprofits and sewing studios to employ women with barriers to employment both in the United States and Cambodia.


WHY??

As two independent women who have worked and lived around the US and the world, we strongly believe that women of all ethnicity and walks of life, wherever they live, should have the opportunity to thrive & to live abundant lives. Lives where they can have fulfilling employment that allows them to provide for their families through a living wage, learn new skills and be empowered to follow their passions and dreams.

We truly believe that no matter where we are, as woman, we are part of a larger tribe of women who want the same things: purpose, love, to provide for our families, good health, to thrive and be inspired. And this inspires us to connect women around the world so that they can support each other

Unfortunately, in many parts of the world, and even here in Denver, many women (such as refugees and women living in poverty) face extreme barriers to employment, a lack of skills and a lack of opportunities that are not exploitative and unsafe. With a commitment to empowering women, a love for fashion that is ethically produced, and inspired by the vibrant fabrics from around the world, TRIBE was born.

The Problem

TRIBE wants to change the fashion industry, so that the focus is on PEOPLE and not just PROFITS.

Did you know?

  • Many of the approximately 40 million workers in the global fashion/garment industry are forced to work in sweatshops or factories with exploitative conditions

  • 85% of garment workers are women, and the majority are in developing countries and live in some degree of poverty

What are sweatshops? Sweatshops are factories that often have oppressive work environments; unfair and extremely low wages; long hours; unsafe facilities; and sometimes allow child labor and no pay (slavery).  A direct result of the “fast fashion” trend, garment workers are often forced to work longer hours for less money as global fashion brands (i.e., apparel available in chain stores across the country) demand lower costs so that they can sell clothing for only a few dollars to consumers.

Does what we pay for clothing matter?

Yes. If we are buying cheap clothing, then we are enabling cheap labor. Whereas people used to invest in a few pieces of clothing to last years, the advent of the $5 t-shirt has allowed consumers to shop ‘til we drop, often at the expense of the garment worker who receives only pennies for their days work.

Learn more about this problem here.

The Solution

Our solution to the exploitation and low wages prevalent in the global fashion industry is a fashion line that puts PEOPLE first, and not profit. It is a fashion line that is inspired BY women, purchased BY or FOR women and that benefits women globally. 

When we visit many fair trade stores across the US and on our travels, the ethically-produced clothing we see are not clothing that we would want to wear. The majority of fair-trade clothing options were not designed for the modern, trendy woman who wants the vibrant colors of Africa or Asia melded with the classic and flattering styles of the West.

This is where TRIBE was born— at the intersection of ethical employment, globally inspired fabrics and flattering design.

Locally Designed: The co-founders of TRIBE are Denver residents, including our designer, Rebecca Taylor. Additionally, TRIBE partners with local social enterprises, including We Made This (employing refugees) and Sox Place Screen Printing (employing homeless youth) for the production of select items. Other U.S.-based partnerships are in development.

Globally Inspired: The colorful fabrics, vibrant cultures and beautiful women we have met while traveling and living around the world inspire each collection. TRIBE’s first collection is an African Wax-Print inspired collection—modern styles with a global flare. The second collection, which is in development for 2018, will be Asia-Inspired.

TRIBE’s goal is to set up a partnership with a fair-trade sewing program in Cambodia for future production starting in 2017, and the seed money from this campaign will allow TRIBE to develop and put this partnership into place.


What We Need & What You Get

We believe that TOGETHER we are TRIBE, and we know we can't do this alone. We are raising $15,000 in seed funding to make TRIBE's long-term vision a success!

Funding from this campaign will provide the seed funding for TRIBE to have impact in five primary ways:
  • Provide training to women with barriers to employment in US and Cambodia
  • Develop and implement production partnerships in Cambodia, and pay for start-up costs related to these partnerships (equipment, fabric, etc)
  • Partner directly with artisans creating the fabric for our clothing. We desire to source fabric for the 2017 and 2018 collections from ethical sources (such as directly from the weavers!)
  • Go into full production (in US and Cambodia)——providing a living wage & empowering environment to all women. The more we raise/sell, the more women we can hire!
  • Give Back: 10% of all sales from the crowdfunding campaign will be donated to Children’s Future

With the investment raised, TRIBE will be able to fully launch its 2017 Collection and begin producing its 2018 Collection. 

And YOU won't go away empty handed!! We have some great perks for you -- investing in this campaigns is the ONLY way you can get your hands on our first set of products (which can be viewed in the photo gallery): TRIBE t-shirt, Maya Make-up Bag, Classic Dress in Electric Coral, Shift Dress in Royal Square or Royal Jade, Cap-Sleeve Dress in Lipstick & Pearls, Pencil Skirt in HoneyComb or Regal Medallion and Circle Skrt in CandyLand or Sorbet.




Additionally, if you choose to invest at higher levels, you can even have the opportunity to have customized collections, Skype with us in Cambodia, and much more :)

The Impact

TRIBE was created to make a positive impact in the world through fashion. At the end of the day TRIBE’s mission is to empower women and give back to the global community, and we do this in multiple ways. With each purchase and investment, you can be assured that there are three primary impacts:

  • Ethical Production: Vulnerable women (and sometimes men!) are provided an opportunity to work in an empowering environment where they can learn sewing skills, be encouraged and receive a living wage. TRIBE ensures that all production partners in the US and Cambodia are ethical and follow fair-trade practices.
  • Environmental: TRIBE desires to reduce our environmental waste by using scraps from the apparel line for the Maya Make-up Bags, our hang tags, and other accessories. We recycle scraps of fabric as much as possible.
  • Charitable: 10% of all sales will be donated to Children’s Future, a nonprofit serving children in rural Cambodia

Other Ways You Can Help

There are a few primary ways you can help!

  • INVEST in our campaign at any level to receive our initial collection -- each shirt, bag, dress and skirt has a different investment level
  • INVEST in our campaign even if you don't want an incentive, but because you are excited about our vision! There are two incentive levels ($50 and $150) that are not linked to any incentives.
  • SHARE this campaign with your friends and family on your Facebook page and via email -- Indiegogo makes it really easy for you!
  • SIGN UP for our email list at www.togetherwearetribe.com
  • FOLLOW us on Facebook
  • FOLLOW us on Instagram @togetherweareTRIBE

story:
….and the next step is a well placed collar link. – Collaration LLC. Being perfectly well dressed gives one a tranquility that no religion can bestow. A gentleman’s wardrobe is indeed a work of art and every essential piece reflects the wearers’ own unique personality - in what way does one express their own unique personality than through accessories.

An accessory is an item, which is used to contribute, in a secondary manner, to the wearer’s outfit. Accessories are often used to complete an outfit and are chosen to specifically complement the wearer’s look. What we have found with men is that we are limited to the basic ties, belts, watches, pocket squares and cufflinks.

Our goal is to offer something new and refreshing that will polish any look and bring it all together, therefore we have created Collar Links. These are similar to cufflinks but designed specifically for the collars of men’s dress shirts. Collaration LLC Collar Links and Collar Stays have a groundbreaking approach that takes collar stays to the next level.

These unique links will give life to any collar. Standout without trying to get noticed, be the conversation piece and the envy of others who dare set foot in a room with you. Start the trend, set the trend and become the trend with Collaration Collar Links and Collar Stays as we bring sophistication to the collar inside and out.

Collaration is a one man shop based in Orlando FL. The creator and founder Durand Smith has been putting all his blood, sweat and tears into every aspect of Collaration for the past two years and finally he's seeing some results. Collaration has been approved to sell our product in the Artegon Market Place Mall in Orlando Florida and we have been approved an exhibiting booth at the MAGIC Marketplace, the world's largest fashion marketplace tradeshow comprised of ten unique communities showcasing the latest in apparel, footwear, accessories, and manufacturing.

With your pledges all funding will go towards manufacturing our collar links on a greater scale, materials to produce products and equipment for both booths here at the Artegon Market Place Mall and MAGIC Marketplace. We ask that you help one man’s dream starting with one collar at a time.


Click Here To Visit Site

Risks and challenges

The risk and challenges that come with completing my project would be if the company that distributes the links stop making the current design being used or if the manufacture is out of stock on certain items/product. If this should occur I have a backup manufacture that can recreate all links currently being issued as pledge items.

When Will I Receive My Perks?

Unlike most campaigns where you wait months for your perk. We will be sending your perks right after the campaign closes.

Delivery time: In manufacturing, there's always a risk that suppliers do not fulfill orders on time. Because we hand piece all our product we are working with some of the top manufactures to ensure our product is delivered in a timely manner. If any order are delayed we will try our best to keep you informed.

Duty/VAT charges: If you live outside of the US, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges.

Paypal Disclaimer

“Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed.”

story:
Hi guys, 

my name is Alesia and I have always had a true love for paintings.  Since I was little I remember staring at them in galleries and wishing I could take those beautiful forms of expression with me at all times. 

This is what inspired me to create a collection of hand crafted wearable canvases.

I would love to take this even further using colorful ropes, chains and beads to form an extension to the tiny painting, so it becomes a wearable installation.

They're fun and unusual and when people notice these pieces of jewelry on me, the first reaction is typically a smile :)

So when jewelry and smiles come together “Smilery”, the name of this project, comes to life.

Another very important reason to call this project this way is that I want “to give back” some smiles too.  So I’m donating 30% of all revenue from this indiegogo initiative to GOKOD hospital (www.grcoc.gomel.by) in Gomel, Belarus - my hometown. After the Chernobyl disaster in 1986, cancer in the area increased by 40-50% and when I happened to be there a few years ago was shocked by the que of people waiting to get their "chemo cocktail"(http://www.chernobyl-children.org.uk/information/the-chernobyl-disaster/the-effects-of-the-accident-on-human-health ). The hospital is in continuous need for better equipment and medicines.

I got in touch with the head of the department Dr. Olga Borsuk who sent this short video that explains how the number of cases continue to increase:  http://youtu.be/rxdjc_sEN7U

So guys, if you would like to support the birth of my jewelry collection and help me "spread the smiles" to people in need, I would really love your help!

I am asking $8,000 to support me to turn this project into a small production, to cover marketing costs and future exhibitions. 

Below is how I plan to use the raised funds in detail.

Also, if you'd like to come and see my work in person, I am very excited invite you to my first show:

Time: 7pm, 

Date: Sept 2nd, 2015

Location: Cocomat store in Soho (49 Mercer St, New York, NY 10013) http://www.coco-mat.com/location-item?i=coco_us.en.stores&id=519

A peek of the Collections:

Thank you very much for you attention and hopefully your support :)
