story:
Our Story

   Since 2012, The Glasgow School of Art Singapore has delivered its first cohort of graduates from the Bachelor of Art (Hons) Programmes in both Communication Design and Interior Design, in partnership with the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT).

   Coming June, from the 20th to the 26th,The GSA Degree Show will be held at National Design Centre (NDC) and it will feature works from the second graduating cohort before they step out into the industry and face the challenges ahead.  We aim to create a fresh and exciting show, to mark the end of our memorable journey through school and celebrate the beginning of our careers entering the industry. We are partially funding our own degree show and are looking to get a good location for the best exposure to the design industry. Hence this campaign would give us the opportunity to fulfill our goal.

   Basically, the contributions will go towards the production and operations of the entire degree show. Your contributions will greatly help in allowing us to have the means to create the best possible show for everyone. All of us from The Glasgow School of Art Singapore sincerely appreciate your effort for bringing us one step closer towards making this possible!


Short Summary

   The GSA Degree Show 2015 by The Glasgow School of Art Singapore’s graduating cohort will greatly appreciate your contributions towards funding our graduation show. It would mean the world to us to have your support in allowing us to create a superb showcase for us and our friends, families, and industry partners. 


Past Fundraising Projects

Art Sale / The D>RT Show

12 December 2014

Canvas Singapore

   The Graduating class of 2015 held a Pop-up store at Canvas Singapore in line with The Dart Show (A 100 Days of GSA Event). There were art works for sale as well as the very first issue of GSA Singapore’s WOLF Magazine. All proceeds from our Art Sale went towards funding The GSA Degree Show 2015. It was an excellent night out with the whole school with good vibes, good music and great art. 



#theGSAFlea

8 – 10 January 2015

SIT Building @ Temasek Polytechnic

   The Glasgow School of Art Singapore's opened our first ever flea market at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) Building at Temasek Polytechnic. Held in conjunction with Temasek Polytechnic’s Open House, #theGSAflea had a wide selection of handmade crafts, accessories, letterpress items, art and design books and prints by our awesome vendors! The GSA Singapore had our own Art Sale booth going on with posters, zines, caricature booth and a photo booth all efforts by the graduation class of 2015. All funds raised during the flea went towards The GSA Degree Show 2015. All in all, #theGSAflea that spanned over 3 days was super fun, and a fantastic start for more fleas in the future.

   



What We Need & What You Get

   We have a targeted goal of USD $5500 and this will go into our efforts for material funds, production funds, equipment rental and operations.

   Our unique perks are designed to offer a variety of options for interested parties to help in our cause. With the bigger contribution options, we have notebooks that will be shipped to your location to show our appreciation. Also, for even larger contributions, the contributors will receive our gradbook with a compilation of works by the graduating cohort of The Glasgow School of Art Singapore's Students. 

   With a generous contribution of USD $500 and above, your name or company's name will be included in our sponsorship / contributors list in our gradbook and also on our sponsorship wall.


Other Ways You Can Help

   We totally understand if you are unable to contribute to our fund raising and we still greatly appreciate your support in spirit. Please do visit our Website, Facebook and Instagram page to be kept up to date for upcoming fringe events, sneak peeks of our works and details of The GSA Degree show 2015. We look forward to see you at our show!
story_txt:
Our Story

   Since 2012, The Glasgow School of
Art Singapore has delivered its first cohort of graduates from the Bachelor of
Art (Hons) Programmes in both Communication Design and Interior Design, in
partnership with the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT).
   Coming June, from the 20th to the 26th,The GSA Degree Show will be held at National Design Centre (NDC) and it will feature works from the second graduating cohort before
they step out into the industry and face the challenges ahead.  We aim to
create a fresh and exciting show, to mark the end of our memorable journey
through school and celebrate the beginning of our careers entering the
industry. We are partially funding our own degree show and are looking to get a
good location for the best exposure to the design industry. Hence this campaign
would give us the opportunity to fulfill our goal.
   Basically,
the contributions will go towards the production and operations of the entire
degree show. Your contributions will greatly help in allowing us to have the
means to create the best possible show for everyone. All of us from The Glasgow
School of Art Singapore sincerely appreciate your effort for bringing us one
step closer towards making this possible!


Short Summary 
   The GSA Degree Show 2015 by The Glasgow
School of Art Singapore’s graduating cohort will greatly appreciate your
contributions towards funding our graduation show. It would mean the world to
us to have your support in allowing us to create a superb showcase for us and
our friends, families, and industry partners. 


Past Fundraising Projects
Art Sale / The D>RT Show
12 December 2014
Canvas Singapore
   The Graduating class of 2015
held a Pop-up store at Canvas Singapore in line with The Dart Show (A 100 Days
of GSA Event). There were art works for sale as well as the very first issue of
GSA Singapore’s WOLF Magazine. All proceeds from our Art Sale went towards
funding The GSA Degree Show 2015. It was an excellent night out with the whole school
with good vibes, good music and great art. 




















#theGSAFlea
8 – 10 January 2015
SIT Building @ Temasek Polytechnic
   The Glasgow
School of Art Singapore's opened our first ever flea market at the Singapore
Institute of Technology (SIT) Building at Temasek Polytechnic. Held in
conjunction with Temasek Polytechnic’s Open House, #theGSAflea had a wide
selection of handmade crafts, accessories, letterpress items, art and design
books and prints by our awesome vendors! The GSA Singapore had our own Art Sale
booth going on with posters, zines, caricature booth and a photo booth all
efforts by the graduation class of 2015. All funds raised during the flea went
towards The GSA Degree Show 2015. All in all, #theGSAflea that spanned over 3 days
was super fun, and a fantastic start for more fleas in the future.
   
















   What We Need & What You Get    We have a targeted goal of USD $5500 and this will go into our efforts for material funds, production funds, equipment rental and operations.

   With a generous contribution of USD $500 and above, your name or company's name will be included in our sponsorship / contributors list in our gradbook and also on our sponsorship wall.

if you are unable to contribute to our fund raising and we still greatly
appreciate your support in spirit. Please do visit our Website, Facebook and

our works and details of The GSA Degree show 2015. We look forward to see you
at our show!

story:
Short Summary

Pay A Sack Forward and V I S S E R have collaborated to create a bag that will bring awareness to the community, while making the lives of those less fortunate a little brighter.

PASF is currently providing a sack of supplies to the homeless of Melbourne and Brisbane, while V I S S E R donates a percentage of sales to help communities in developing countries. 

We have designed a bag to be sold and for each purchased, another, filled with goods will go to someone on the streets. Each bag is styled with inspirational quotes, aiming to uplift and give hope to everyone who reads it. Our goal is to provide the homeless with some necessities, while hoping to empower and elevate through the act of giving and positive affirmations. 

We will have bags for sale in various cafes and stores throughout Australia, as well as online. We plan to have regular events and packing days to promote our mission.

Each contribution will benefit an individual directly. We will have a bag launch and packing day on Sunday, February 15, 2015 and will distribute the bags to the homeless in early February. 


What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise funds so we can provide for the many homeless people living on our streets. Around 1 in 200 is homeless every night and 42% are under the age of 25 (ABS Census of housing and population, 2011).

$5000 is the goal we are aiming for and with this, we can make the lives of people richer. The bags given are covered in inspirational quotes and are designed to motivate and empower the receiver. 

We plan to sell online to reach a broader audience, which will in turn require some funds to kickstart it.

Each contributor will receive a quality canvas bag that we have designed and manufactured. Another one filled with essential supplies (pillow, blanket, toothbrush, toothpaste, water, tuna, beans, cereal) will go to someone living on the streets. 

We are passionate about this project and helping our local community and aim to fulfil orders and supply the homeless with our bags with any funds raised.


The Impact

Our individual projects are currently affecting many people, giving them hope and support, so we believe that our collaboration can only serve to impact more people, while generating awareness through our bag concept. 

We wish to expand in time to other states in Australia and develop other ways in which to aid the homeless community through empowerment and education. Our hope is to make a difference in people's lives and to work towards making homelessness less prevalent.


Risks & Challenges

With eventual plans to expand to other states in Australia comes challenges. We would need to recruit people to manage collections, packing days and distribution and have solid structures in place. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate that many people would love to contribute but are unable to at this point in time. However, showing support by promoting us on any social media platform and word of mouth is our most valuable contribution and we would be so grateful for this. Please use the links on Indiegogo and on our Facebook to share with friends. Thank you!

story:
Simple and absolutely no nonsense smart watch which does not require everyday charging.















Risks & Challenges.

Promotion is our utmost challenge. Spreading the word about our watch is a mammoth task and we hope with your help we can reach the world.  The response on the market research and the feedback from our friends and backers has made us come  to Indiegogo and we believe we will make a big difference.

There are so many beautiful watches to choose from and we guarantee that our watch is nothing like you have ever seen. The results are in your hands, the more you spread the word, the sooner and easier it is for us to bring our product to reality.


Spread the word.

If you have a family member or friend who might be interested in our watch, please refer our product. 

UVN Shake is brought to you by EinkClocks. We have been manufacturing frames and clocks for over a decade and we know how to build clocks. Buy a shake watch and support us, to bring this awesome watch to life. 



FAQ


Is the watch waterproof?

UVN Shake watches are water resistant. But we advice you not to wear it while you are swimming. 

How about the warranty?

The watch comes with 1 Year Standard Warranty.

Does the watch have a touch screen?

No. Unlike other smart watches, UVN Shake watches are not touch sensitive.

What phones are compatible with UVN Shake watches?

All Android and iOS phones.

Does the watch display messages, emails and social status?

No. The watch alerts you when you receive an update. It glows in more than 12 different colors and vibrates, to indicate the type of alert you have received. The alert messages and vibrations are on for a period of 10 seconds. 

Can the watch find my phone?

Yes. Built in sensors vibrates continuously when you leave your phone behind. Also the phone's led glows pink when you are away from the phone.

Do I have to charge the watch?

No. Our main goal is to build a watch that does not require everyday charging. The watch has an inbuilt solar panel along with a lithium battery which keeps it on forever. ( Replace battery once a year for better performance)

How long does the battery last?

We estimate that you can go on for at least a year before you replace your battery. No charging is required.



Thank you

We thank each one of you for your support and contribution. Every single penny counts. Every share means a lot to us. Your feedback has made a lot of difference the way we have seen things.

Please refer our project on Facebook and Twitter and help us realize our dream.

If you have any suggestions on improving the product, please feel free to write to us at support@einkclocks.net

Thank you for your time.

story:
PLANNED FANCY VERSIONS OF THE PRODUCT, FROM COLOURS TO BLING OR YOU SUGGEST THEM!


THE PRODUCT

This is the first model in the line of protective products for mobile devices. The first case is for the iPhone 6. The iPhone 6+ version will follow and then cases for the most popular and most vulnerable mobile devices in the market. The possibilities to extend the product line are endless!

 Of course the initial idea for the strong case came from the reports of 'Bendgate' about the iPhone 6 and 6+. However, I did further research and found out that other mobile devices are also becoming vulnerable due to their larger size and thin profile.

My video above shows some broken mobile phones that were subjected to severe tests with a test machine and others were simply damaged with the bare hands (the iPhone 6!)

British comedian Jason Manford managed to destroy his mini iPad with his seat!


This is the link to the most famous test on the iPhone 6 by 'Unbox Therapy'. It has had an amazing 62.6 million hits and the presenter is not even a pop star!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=znK652H6yQM

DESIGN

It is nice to have an enclosure made of plastic, leather, fabric or rubber for the basic mechanical protection against damage and also for reasons of aesthetics and comfort in use by having a tactile material. I chose plastic as one can mould in several features for the functions I want my protective case to have. However, these materials cannot provide much protection against bending or pressure unless they are rather thick and we do not want to end up with a chunky enclosure for a nice and slim device.

The only other solution is to use a very rigid material, such as steel, to provide the rigidity that is needed in the case to protect the mobile device against bending. Attempts have been made to make metal enclosures for mobile phones. However, they have a problem: the manufacturers of these mobile devices do not like metal, carbon fibre or magnets in the proximity of their devices as they can cause interference to their radio signals and their sensors such as magnetic compass, proximity sensor and gyroscope.

My solution is to add a reinforcing element to the soft case, made of steel and inserted in the plastic body of the case. However, this element must not add considerable weight to the case, it must not make the case too chunky and it must not be close to the mobile device when it is in use. I designed a metal component based on my calculations of maximum strength with the minimum of material used and this is the resulting shape: it adds aesthetic value to the case too. But this is not all: I have designed it in such a way that the metal part is close the the mobile phone when not it use and stored such as in a trouser rear pocket. However, when the case is opened for use, the metal part is moved away from the device so that it will not cause interference.

Early test pieces to determine the size and number of steel members that will provide the maximum reinforcement with the minimum of weight and thickness.


 Snap shots from my video above showing my tests with the working prototypes of my case:

 CAD model for 3D printing:

 PRESENT STATUS

So where am I now? I am making these cases on a small scale by 3D printing, this is limiting in the numbers I can produce and the price of the products is high so I need to take it to the real production methods that will allow me to make a quality product at an affordable price and in large quantities. These production methods are injection moulded plastic and metal.

PATENT

I have applied for a patent for this product and its inventiveness is protected. Britsh Patent application number: GB1423232.6

And I own the copyright to the product image.


YOUR MONEY PLEDGE - WHY I NEED YOUR SUPPORT

Your kind contributions will be used for adapting the design for production, to manufacture the injection moulding tools for plastic and to order the first production units for sale. I have already invested a considerable number of man hours and in the making of the prototoypes and testing getting the product to its present stage of development.

I have already started putting together a marketing plan that includes the product price and substantial promotion, primarily through the Internet. I intend to sell the product through my company and grow the product line.

Of course this is not going to be the only product. I will continue to make new versions for other mobile devices, including the iPads, Kindles and the like.

Please look at my scale of rewards on this page. Help me get this product in the market for all of you to enjoy.

MY BACKGROUND

I have a Masters degree in Product Design from the prestigious Central Saint Martins University of the Arts in London. I have more than 35 years of experience working on product design continuously. I have my own design consultancy business and I have a proven track record of products that have returned substantial profits for my clients.

Added to this, I have designed several IT products for use in extreme environments in fields such as transport, medicine, shipping, the army, the navy, office and consumer products. I have taken my know-how from the design of rugged products to the consumer and commercial product fields, such as on this product.

Here are some examples of my work:

Thank you for watching. Send me your queries through this website.

Risks and challenges

There are always challenges in the process to take a new product to the market. Here are the most common types and how I will tackle them with my experience:

1-There is not enough interest in the product to generate substantial sales.
Solution: I have experience with taking the products I design until they reach the market, so I know that there have been some that did not quite make it....My solution to this would be to make sure that I sell enough of them, at a reduced price, in order to recover the investment and move on to another product idea...

2- I may have underestimated the cost to take the product to the market. Perhaps the injection moulding tools will be more expensive, the process to adapt the product to production is more costly and time consuming or there is not enough funding for marketing.
Solution: I will seek further funding from a Business Angel, grants, government help. I will try everything in the way of matching funds against what I have managed to raise through Kickstarter.

3- My product gets copied. It happens to the best of people.
Solution: I have a patent application, which will be of great help, if and when it is granted, in order to defend my territory.

4- I end up with a one product company. When the product reaches the end of its life, there will be nothing else to sell.
Solution: That is why I am thinking of the new versions of the product for other types of mobile device. There a loads of them: Kindles, all kinds of iPADS, Galaxy phones, you name them.

story:
Synopsis

A man on a mission, a good read. Take a second to see beyond the natural, healthy effects of these perfumes and appreciate the employment opportunities this creates around the world!

The Rising Phoenix Perfumery is known for its naturally-minded products made without harmful chemicals such, as parabens and phthalates. In a bid to provide local artisans a chance to preserve an ancient and dying art, its Attar line is world renowned. Combining conservation with culture, Rising Phoenix is now poised for another critical step in its journey, with the development of alcohol-based spray Eau De Parfum (EdP) fragrance line. While there is massive demand for its products, and production and distribution channels are in place, a final capital push is needed in the form of US$350,000. Help Rising Phoenix soar in its crowdfunding efforts and support this family based enterprise that believes in business ethics and preserving the unique heritage of natural fragrance.
 

About The Rising Phoenix Perfumery

 

Hello! My name is JK DeLapp, founder and perfumer of The Rising Phoenix Perfumery, based in Atlanta, Georgia.

If you don’t know us, Rising Phoenix is a 100% family-owned artisanal perfumery based out of Atlanta, Georgia. Although we’re a small outfit, we’ve won acclaim from leading perfume critics, including the famed Luca Turin, for our perfumes, one of which was nominated for the Independent Perfume award of the 2016 Art and Olfaction Awards.

We do things differently from the big perfume corporations – every perfume we make is painstakingly made by hand using natural, rare raw materials, many of which we distill or produce ourselves, such as precious Oud oils from the Far East, Sandalwood oil from India, Indonesia, and Timor Island, and Frankincense Oils from Oman, Ethiopia and Somalia. Our fragrances are naturally minded and we have done our best to eliminate unnecessary chemicals that produce a toxic burden - both on the individual and on the planet.

What have we eliminated, you might ask??

  • Parabens
  • Sulfates
  • Phthalates
  • Silicone
  • PG, DPG, and DOP
  • Triclosan
  • Nitro Musks

Why is eliminating these chemicals from fragrances important?

Several synthetic ingredients such as nitro musks (banned in the industry already), phthalates and some fixatives can cause headaches, which is why I chose not to use these materials in my fragrances.

Many of us have begun to worry about the cumulative effect of these chemicals on our health and on our environment - so many have begun to try to limit their exposure to them. Research indicates that phthalates are a type of endocrine disruptor, and in the past few years, studies have linked these plasticizers to asthma, attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder, breast cancer, obesity and type II diabetes, neurodevelopmental issues, autism spectrum disorders, altered reproductive development and male fertility issues. Parabens, which are commonly used as preservatives, are also known to interfere with hormone production.

As a medical practitioner...this is very meaningful. The list of problems above sounds like a good deal of the people walking into my clinic.

So how does Rising Phoenix go about doing things differently?

Now, when I say “we”, let me be clear: I’m talking about the team of artisan distillers across South East Asia, Africa, and the USA that I have put together over the past 6 years.

Rising Phoenix is a family business, and we do our best to keep the work we do “in the family”. Granted, not every material Rising Phoenix uses is produced in house – but we do our best to keep our supply chain personal and use it as a way to employ countless people who need the work and support, and do our best to support local movements around the globe moving towards total sustainability.

My father and grandfather have worked in the corporate world for many years, and I am lucky to be able to draw on their enormous banks of experience. Their work has touched the lives of countless people across the globe, and I’ve taken it upon myself to continue the family tradition of ingenuity and excellence.

Me, I come to perfume by way of Chinese Medicine: I am actually a licensed physician in Chinese Medicine, and I still treat patients through the week. My time spent working in leading hospitals in China and studying the effects of herbs and botanicals on the human body gave me great respect for the natural raw materials in our world and their effect not only on the Body, but on the Spirit and Mind, too. Making naturally-minded fragrances is a natural extension of that, for me.

But I’ll tell you what the most important lesson my Dad taught me: he taught me the value of hard work. We are a family of bootstrappers. We are not wealthy people, but damn, we know about hard work. We might be cash-poor, but we’re knowledge-rich, and I know that counts for something in this day and age.

I need your help. Yes, you, who’s reading this right now.  By selling just 3,500 full bottles of the new EDPs, I will reach my target and you will have helped officially launch RPP into the market!

The Rising Phoenix Perfumery is at a crossroads, and our next move is crucial. To date, we’ve been making small batches of Attars, which are concentrated, oil-based perfumes with no alcohol in them. These sell well, especially to connoisseurs of millennia-old Middle and Far Eastern perfumery, and there is a very quickly growing appreciation of them in the West.

But I need to scale up. It’s now or never. The business needs cash to make the crucial jump to larger-batch production, distribution, and selling. To this end, we’ve introduced a range of alcohol-based spray perfumes that carry all the luxury and prestige of the Attar line, just in a different, more saleable format. We want to sell these in markets where we know there’s huge demand, such as Russia and the Middle East. How do I know there’s demand? I have several hundred thousand in Purchase Orders already lined up, as well as partnerships with key distributors in the regions.

Only one piece of the puzzle is missing: the money. To break into these larger markets, I need tons more bottles, packaging, raw materials, labels, and so on. I will still make everything myself, by hand. But I lack the financial means to make this last leap.

Specifically, I need $350,000 in order to bring my business to the next level.

3500 FULL BOTTLE contributions would fully fund the project! I know that $350,000 sounds like a lot...but really, it's only 3500 full bottles! Totally feasible!

YOU can be the missing part of the puzzle. Donate money, and not only do you get rewards in the form of damn fine fragrances, but you get to be in on the ground floor of this amazing investment into our future. We are a family of bootstrappers – but I’m reaching my hand up to you to make that last final push over the wall. Will you give me your hand?

 

Here’s where YOUR donation will go:

·      Bottle-manufacturing and packaging: specifically, brand new bottles and packaging for the 2 product lines I have developed – the attar line and the Eau de Parfum (EdP) line. You will see a shot of the new EdP bottle design in the video above. The Attar bottles are currently being finalized.

·      Raw materials: In perfume terms, we call the contents of the bottle the “juice”. Since we focus on the high quality, natural raw materials, including costly distillates and absolutes that we produce ourselves in partnership with distillers and farmers in developing countries, the “juice” is the most expensive part!

·      Travel expenses: A small portion of the funds will go towards necessary travel expenses such as visiting on-site distillations and farming cooperatives in developing countries.

 

These are the results we anticipate thanks to YOUR donation:

·      Rising Phoenix goes global: Your donation will ensure that Rising Phoenix is able to make the next step from small, family business to a business that distributes its products in global markets, thus multiplying local production and employment in our supplier countries.

·      Fulfillment of purchase orders: If I raise the money for the new bottles and packaging, this will enable me to fulfill the $500,000 in purchase orders I already have and move into global distribution channels.

·      Employment in low-income countries: Rising Phoenix pays a decent living wage to dozens of local famers and distillers in 20+ developing countries around the world, which in turns supports the family incomes and their workers, totaling hundreds of members in total. YOUR donation will help ensure that Rising Phoenix’s employment support to low-income families in developing countries not only continues but also grows exponentially with the business. 

The Impact of YOUR donation:

Above, we listed all the results of YOUR donation – those are the numerable, quantifiable outputs that will come about as part of your generosity. But impact is different: impact is a broader set of outcomes that will continue to affect the “big picture” of the Rising Phoenix Perfumery and the people it supports around the globe. Impact is sometimes hard to quantify – you can’t measure it in numbers. So I’ll give it the old college try with words instead.

Suffice it to say, your contribution to Rising Phoenix will help countless people involved in creating the materials that go into Rising Phoenix products. Your support is helping to directly support our grass roots supply chain in over 20 countries! We’ve mentioned that already, but think about what that means for those workers a minute. It means being able to provide for their families and send their kids to school. It means they can survive without having to scrape by.

Additionally, once the Rising Phoenix commercial line is fully operational - I have license to several thousand acres across several countries in South East Asia that I plan to begin populating and growing our own biodynamic Agarwood and Sandalwood plantations - further supporting the local peoples I am partnered with, and adding to the sustainability and natural bio-diversity of species that have become endangered and over-harvested (some almost to the point of extinction). If I get to this point, I will be helping re-plant and re-forest decimated species and ravaged land. That is good for the planet, for the families that live off the land in those countries, and will eventually help decrease illegal harvesting elsewhere.

Now, how many fragrance companies do you know who are doing that!? 

Probably the most unusual feat I will be able to accomplish with your support will be to kick into action a plan to custom distill attars in the traditional Indian manner with the oldest family distiller in India, a way of life that has been dying out in India over the last few decades thanks to mass-production. That would be a traditionally distilled line of Attars that I have designed. That is to come in the near future as a Stage 2, once we are fully operational. No one on the planet is doing perfumery like this!

 

Here are your rewards for donating to this campaign:

·      Heavily discounted perfume: Take a look at the sidebar here – you will see a list of Eau de Parfums, attars, and sets, discounted at rates you will never find on a store shelf, and savings of up to $460 on certain items. YOU get to choose which perfume you want and which level of investment you want to go in at.

·      Exclusivity: In return for YOUR donation, you will get access to certain perfumes even before they are released to the market. Grab your chance to be part of a panel that tests and evaluates early mods of a perfume before it hits the shelves, allowing you to possibly shape and guide the final product!

·      The chance to sample rare raw materials: Have you ever smelled real oud or sandalwood in its original wood or oil form? How about frankincense? Would you like to? We are offering you the rare opportunity to not only smell the finished perfumes but also to smell the precious raw materials that go into the perfumes. As far as we know, no other fragrance company allows for this option!

**Once the campaign wraps - I pull the trigger. This means that I'll be able to get to work on the samples immediately.

**For the full bottles - it will take the bottle manufacturers 2-3 months before I receive the initial newly manufactured bottles. I imagine it may take me up to a month to finalize assembly and begin shipping packages. You'll notice I put "December 2017" as the estimated delivery date. I hope to be able to have the items shipped and in your hands before that, but I'm putting December as a last expected ETA on delivery of your rewards.

What’s already in place:

Don’t worry – I am not asking for funding without having already done a lot of the hard work! I come from a family that believes in hard graft, remember? YOUR donation will help fill in the gaps I can’t fill by myself. But you will be investing in a structure that’s ready and just raring to go!

·      $500k in purchase orders lined up

·      $2m in advertizing lined up

·      Distributors in key foreign markets such as the USA, Russia and the Middle-East already lined up

·      EdP Bottle design, labeling, and packaging already completed – just need the money to order them!

·      The perfume formulae already in place and ready for production

·      Local distillation and supplier relationships on the ground in 20 countries in place

·      HUGE support from fragrance critics, bloggers, media, and fans for our work – Luca Turin has reviewed our fragrances favorably, as have many others. There is a bank of goodwill out there for us, and we are not about to squander it.

·      Media blitz for the product line launch already designed and ready for implementation

 

All that is needed at this point is the remaining $350K in funding to pull the trigger and begin the manufacturing process. Your support will allow me to finalize everything I’ve been working towards over the past few years! THANK YOU in advance.

My Track Record:

I am an experienced perfumer and businessman. In 2016, I shipped thousands of packages of product into 35 countries - all compounded and bottled by hand, right here out of my home-based operation in Atlanta.

I am a do-it-yourself kind of guy, and I am not afraid of hard work. I love what I do, so I absolutely don’t mind being in the atelier bottling perfumes at 4am in the morning!

Hard work and talent brings rewards, though. My fragrance, Musk Rose Attar, was a finalist in the 2016 global Art and Olfaction Awards, selected from a pool of hundreds of different perfumes from firms all around the globe. 

My perfume Phoenix Fougère was recently reviewed by famed perfume critic, Luca Turin, who went so far as to say that it is “…what could well be the best Fougère since Paul Parquet’s Fougère Royale, though more citrusy, less animalic and none the worse for it.” In other words – the best Fougere since the invention of Fougeres and the advent of Modern Perfumery!

Rising Phoenix has received rave reviews from dozens of top bloggers and review companies like Fragrantica, CaFleureBon, and Basenotes. A quick Google search of "JK DeLapp Rising Phoenix" will get you dozens of hits of reviews and interviews from a wide variety of publications and in several languages.

Rising Phoenix is currently the largest supplier of Agarwood, Oud, and Ambergris in North America. If you are a connoisseur of Artisan Oud or Artisan Sandalwood oils, then undoubtedly you are familiar with our custom-distilled line of premium Rising Phoenix Ouds and premium Mysore Sandalwood Oils.

I have ties in the fragrance community and consider myself an active, interested member! I have long-standing relationships with the co-founder of Fragrantica, Zoran Knezevic - whom I consider a good friend and Mentor - as well as with CaFleureBon's Editor-in-Chief, Michelin Camen, whom has been an invaluable resource of advice and feedback over the years.

I also owe a big (BIG!) thanks to Claire Vukcevic - frequent contributor over at Basenotes - for her invaluable input and help in polishing the written portion of this campaign. Without Claire, I don't know how I would have put all the writing together!

I was also featured in the documentary Ancient Secrets: Essential Oils Movie:

https://www.essentialoilsmovie.com/about/cast/

I love to share my knowledge with others. I created and now offer 2 very successful online perfumery courses with thousands of students in over 30 countries, through a partner company, Floracopeia: http://www.floracopeia.com/searchresults/?keywo...

One of the distillers with whom I work actually started out as a student of mine and has grown to be one of the most successful distillation and cosmetic operations in Armenia. I have developed an all-natural cosmetics line that I hope to launch in the year following the commercial launch, made exclusively from materials we plan to extract together. If you’d like to check out this company and former student of mine, please visit: www.nairian.am

As you can see...I've been hard at work the past few years, and I need your help to take this last big leap and put my products into the hands of everyone!

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

 

I know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

I would GREATLY appreciate your help in spreading the word about the work that I am doing, and my campaign to raise the funds that I need to accomplish the next phase of manufacturing!

Your support will help me to manifest my dream of a retail ready line, and will go further to help support countless people around the world who are involved in the work that I do to create these marvelous fragrances!

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to help me spread the word to your friends and family, and I'd appreciate your encouraging them to support my work.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about my work - and I look forward to helping you smell fabulous!

~JK DeLapp

Founder, The Rising Phoenix Perfumery

Atlanta, Georgia - USA

 

 

 

What do the fragrances smell like?

**I will be posting an upcoming review of the fragrances as soon as it hits the press in a few days! For now...I hope this suffices:

Afghan Smoke

The scent of an Arabian Souk

Rich spices, tanned leather, and incense smoke

Top Notes:

Bergamot

Cassis Bud

Heart Notes:

Jasmine

Lavender

Tobacco

Base Notes:

Vanilla

Vetiver

Sandalwood

Birch Tar

 

 

Frontier

The scent of the original “Cowboy Colognes” of the American Frontier

Top Notes:

Basil

Anise

Rum Extract

Heart Notes:

Saffron

Poplar Bud

Cedarwood

Sandalwood

Vanilla

Tolu Balsam

Birch Tar

 

Green Velvet

Velvety Green SandalWoodiness.

Sometimes less really does mean more.

Lemongrass

Lime

Petitgrain

Heart Notes:

Cedarwood

Labdanum

Geranium

Sandalwood

Vetiver

Cedarwood

 

More Beauty Than Beast

Floral. Sensual. Voluptuous. Animalic.

Grapefruit

Cardamom

Rum Extract

Heart Notes:

Ylang

Jasmine

Rose

Pimento Leaves

Sandalwood

 

Phoenix Fougere

“What could well be the best Fougère since

Paul Parquet’s Fougère Royale”

-Luca Turin

Mandarin

Lavender

Davana

Heart Notes:

Jasmine

Ylang

Orange Flower

SynopsisA man on a mission, a good read. Take a second to see beyond the natural, healthy effects of these perfumes and appreciate the employment opportunities this creates around the world!The Rising Phoenix Perfumery is known for its naturally-minded products made without harmful chemicals such, as parabens and phthalates. In a bid to provide local artisans a chance to preserve an ancient and dying art, its Attar line is world renowned. Combining conservation with culture, Rising Phoenix is now poised for another critical step in its journey, with the development of alcohol-based spray Eau De Parfum (EdP) fragrance line. While there is massive demand for its products, and production and distribution channels are in place, a final capital push is needed in the form of US$350,000. Help Rising Phoenix soar in its crowdfunding efforts and support this family based enterprise that believes in business ethics and preserving the unique heritage of natural fragrance. About The Rising Phoenix Perfumery Hello! My name is JK DeLapp, founder and perfumer of The Rising Phoenix Perfumery, based in Atlanta, Georgia.If you don’t know us, Rising Phoenix is a 100% family-owned artisanal perfumery based out of Atlanta, Georgia. Although we’re a small outfit, we’ve won acclaim from leading perfume critics, including the famed Luca Turin, for our perfumes, one of which was nominated for the Independent Perfume award of the 2016 Art and Olfaction Awards.We do things differently from the big perfume corporations – every perfume we make is painstakingly made by hand using natural, rare raw materials, many of which we distill or produce ourselves, such as precious Oud oils from the Far East, Sandalwood oil from India, Indonesia, and Timor Island, and Frankincense Oils from Oman, Ethiopia and Somalia. Our fragrances are naturally minded and we have done our best to eliminate unnecessary chemicals that produce a toxic burden - both on the individual and on the planet.What have we eliminated, you might ask??
Parabens
Sulfates
Phthalates
Silicone
PG, DPG, and DOP
Triclosan
Nitro Musks
Why is eliminating these chemicals from fragrances important?Several synthetic ingredients such as nitro musks (banned in the industry already), phthalates and some fixatives can cause headaches, which is why I chose not to use these materials in my fragrances.Many of us have begun to worry about the cumulative effect of these chemicals on our health and on our environment - so many have begun to try to limit their exposure to them. Research indicates that phthalates are a type of endocrine disruptor, and in the past few years, studies have linked these plasticizers to asthma, attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder, breast cancer, obesity and type II diabetes, neurodevelopmental issues, autism spectrum disorders, altered reproductive development and male fertility issues. Parabens, which are commonly used as preservatives, are also known to interfere with hormone production.As a medical practitioner...this is very meaningful. If you’d like to check out this company and former student of mine, please visit: www.nairian.amAs you can see...I've been hard at work the past few years, and I need your help to take this last big leap and put my products into the hands of everyone! Other Ways You Can Help! I know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!I would GREATLY appreciate your help in spreading the word about the work that I am doing, and my campaign to raise the funds that I need to accomplish the next phase of manufacturing!Your support will help me to manifest my dream of a retail ready line, and will go further to help support countless people around the world who are involved in the work that I do to create these marvelous fragrances!Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to help me spread the word to your friends and family, and I'd appreciate your encouraging them to support my work.Thank you so much for taking the time to read about my work - and I look forward to helping you smell fabulous!~JK DeLappFounder, The Rising Phoenix PerfumeryAtlanta, Georgia - USA   What do the fragrances smell like?**I will be posting an upcoming review of the fragrances as soon as it hits the press in a few days! For now...I hope this suffices:Afghan SmokeThe scent of an Arabian SoukRich spices, tanned leather, and incense smokeTop Notes:BergamotCassis BudHeart Notes:JasmineLavenderTobaccoBase Notes:VanillaVetiverSandalwoodBirch Tar  FrontierThe scent of the original “Cowboy Colognes” of the American FrontierTop Notes:BasilAniseRum ExtractHeart Notes:SaffronPoplar BudCedarwoodBase Notes:SandalwoodVanillaTolu BalsamBirch Tar Green VelvetVelvety Green SandalWoodiness.Sometimes less really does mean more.Top Notes:LemongrassLimePetitgrainHeart Notes:CedarwoodLabdanumGeraniumBase Notes:SandalwoodVetiverCedarwood More Beauty Than BeastFloral. Sensual. Voluptuous. Animalic.Top Notes:GrapefruitCardamomRum ExtractHeart Notes:YlangJasmineRosePimento LeavesBase Notes:VanillaSandalwood Phoenix Fougere“What could well be the best Fougère sincePaul Parquet’s Fougère Royale”-Luca TurinTop Notes:MandarinLavenderDavanaHeart Notes:JasmineYlangOrange FlowerGeraniumBase Notes:SandalwoodPatchouliMoss

story:
I'm Danny, my passion is watches, especially mechanical watches. Famous brand name watches are produced in Switzerland but they are extremely expensive and unaffordable for most people.  Because of this, I gathered knowledge in Switzerland and learned the skills required to create precise and high quality watches that could  be personalized for each client.  A special and one-of-a-kind timepiece personalized with a special message on the rotor.  

Today, I start this campaign and request contributors to support my project to bring everyone high quality and precise personalized watches at reasonable prices.  

 

 

 
 
Easy Quick Release Straps - Change the look of your watch in seconds

Easy Quick Release Straps - Change the look of your watch in seconds

story:
My Pedigree ..

Hello, my name is Susey, mother of 3 and I am passionate about Design in all its forms, from fashion to photography and jewellery to cosmetics.  I hold a Masters Degree in Creative Collaborations, specialising in Shoe Design, as well as a Fashion Design Degree, and I am a lifelong learner, always looking at new and interesting ways to either help people or learn new skills.

I have included perks that span most of my design range .. so not just makeup is on offer as a perk .. as my skillsets are quite wide ..  I wanted to give everyone a chance to sponsor me .. not just those interested in makeup .. there is even a menswear option for latex for those interested ..

 The clothing items both latex and fabric can be found on my Etsy Store of the same name Phoenixx Designs UK .. all items used for perks can be found on that platform .. here is the link .. https://www.etsy.com/uk/shop/PhoenixxDesignsUK?... .. all measurement queries for those clothing items listed here .. can be found on my Etsy store and all items shown here are far cheaper than on my Etsy Store .. so you can grab a bargain here as well as helping the Campaign .. 

 

y 

My Cosmetics Journey .. 

Due to my daughters interest in becoming a Makeup Artist, I felt that I needed to find out as much as I can about what could be her career choice, hence my foray into Cosmetics and soaps etc. I only started this journey to help her, but it seems from the feedback from my MUA friends etc, that a lot of people are not happy with the amount of chemical-laced cosmetics currently on the market, as the skin is porous it becomes a worry for most of us.

What I want is to provide these items to a wider audience .. to be able to do this .. I need to adhere to certain safety certifications etc ..

So this project will help me to create a range of safer and more ecological range of cosmetics ..  for others to enjoy too - win/win! 

All products are:-

Paraben free 
Petroleum free
Talc free  
Palm oil free 
Formaldehyde free  
Mica is mined outside of India  
Vegan friendly

I have already done some market research using my Facebook page and have asked friends and MUAs to test out a few prototypes that I have formulated and they have been pleasantly surprised and have written reviews on my page too.  So this is the next logical step to get certified for sale to the general public.

Costs involved ..

To get certified for 6 formulations costs £179 x 3.

I have already forumulated eyeshadows - both shimmer, creams and matt, highlighters (liquid, solid and creams), glitter, blusher, mineral foundation.
 
I am currently formulating mascara, eyeliners, liquid foundation, cream foundation, lip gloss, lipstick both solid and liquids.  

To get 6-8 soaps certified costs £179.

I have teenage kids suffering from acne and eczema and a partner with psoriasis so wanted to give them safe ways to treat those issues.

To buy a safety certificate for nail varnishes costs £195 
(until 12th May when it will increase).

This is part of my own beauty regime, so would feel lost without my nails, hence including this as part of the Range.

To get 6 Beauty products certified costs £179. 

I am currently researching ways to help mature skin, using essential oils to help with healing scars, wrinkle serums and dark circles as well as brown spots etc.

To get 6 Hair products certified costs £179.

Shampoos, conditioners, hair oils, serums etc.

Packaging, Labelling and Printing ..

I am also looking at packaging ideas for my products, to enable them to look professional and noteworthy.  Labelling is also compulsory for the saftey certificate process and is very strict as to what is needed on the labels.

What you get for your money ..

The perks I can provide to you as a contributor are far and wide, 

Fashion Designer, 
Photographer, 
Jewellery Designer, 
Textiles Designer, 
Plus size Specialist Fashion Designer, 
Latex Fashion Designer, 
Headdress Designer, 
Fine Artist, 
Cosmetics Designer.

Please note that all latex items are cheaper to buy on here than on my Etsy site .. therefore saving you pennies for your next purchase!

However, even your moral support will be greatly appreciated to get the word out with likes and most importantly Shares, my quest for more organic based Cosmetics and Soaps.

NB .. All orders over £20 will be sent special delivery .. hence the postage costs being a little higher for your added protection .. so that items do not get lost in the post etc ..

Thank you for reading my campaign text.

Susey ..
xxx

story:
FIND THE ENGLISH VERSION BELOW

 

Que peut-on faire avec une FOXTER Exalt:

 

 
 

 

Le projet est né d'une idée très simple: une montre ne doit pas être seulement un objet qui indique l'heure. Pour un homme, c'est aussi un accessoire de luxe qui reflète son goût et sa personnalité, un bijou à afficher. Quel est le sens de ces montres connectées à écran LED qui fleurissent aujourd'hui, sur lesquelles l'utilisateur doit bouger son bras pour obtenir l'heure, et qui plus est conçu par des gens qui n'ont pas encore compris qu'un écran noir est très loin de l'esthétique.


Nous avons donc créé la première montre hybride premium: c'est une vraie montre, avec son propre cœur qui bat, un vrai écran et de vraies aiguilles au lieu d'un écran LED si laid que nous rencontrons sur Smartwatches. 
Et cette montre donne bien plus que l'heure: un appel, un message, l'emplacement de votre smartphone et bien plus encore. Restez informé .... mais avec discrétion!

 

En cas de commande, le choix de votre modèle se fera après avoir procédé au règlement. Vous recevrez un email de la part de FOXTER Watches vous permettant de choisir quel(s) modèle(s) vous souhaitez acquérir.

 

Matériau de première qualité

Notre montre est un un objet exceptionnel conçu par un horloger de la célèbre "Place Vendôme". En effet, le FOXTER Exalt a vu le jour en France, à Paris.
Nous avons choisi les meilleurs composants possibles, fabriqués à partir des matériaux les plus résistants, vous offrant le summum du confort et de la facilité d'utilisation, ainsi que les dernières innovations.

En tant que joyau technologique, nous avons choisi de fabriquer notre montre hybride en Asie, où ses fonctions logicielles ont également été développées. Nous avons pensé qu'il était préférable de s'assurer qu'il a été assemblé près de ceux qui ont développé ses fonctions de manière à ce qu'elles puissent être parfaitement configurées.

Notre modèle FOXTER Exalt est en édition limitée et numéroté à 2000 unités.

 

Alors que nous venions de finaliser les premiers prototypes de notre FOXTER Exalt, notre projet a été sélectionné par le gouvernement français pour ses qualités innovantes. En conséquence, nous avons participé au salon CES de Las Vegas en janvier 2017, dans le pavillon French Tech où nous avons pu présenter le prototype de notre montre à des acheteurs potentiels.

Depuis que notre modèle Exalt a été présenté au CES de Las Vegas, plus de 25 000 personnes se sont jointes à notre communauté Facebook. Nous publions régulièrement des photos et des vidéos sur les progrès du projet pour nos fans. Alors rejoignez-nous sur nos pages de médias sociaux!

Depuis que notre modèle Exalt a été présenté au CES de Las Vegas, plus de 25 000 personnes se sont jointes à notre communauté Facebook. Nous publions régulièrement des photos et des vidéos sur les progrès du projet pour nos fans. Alors rejoignez-nous sur nos pages de médias sociaux!

Presse:

 

 

- Une Interview avec BeTerrific pendant le dernier salon CES de Las Vegas:

 

Chargement par induction:

 

Bien avant d'être un objet connecté, la montre FOXTER Exalt a été développée dans le respect solennel des plus pure traditions horlogères. C'est le résultat d'une quête de l'esthétique sublimé.
L'ADN de la montre est profondément ancré dabs ce fondement esthétique qui est l'origine même du projet.

 

Nous proposons 6 bracelets différents selon votre envie. Vous trouverez ci-dessous chacun d'eux. Il s'agit de bracelets en cuir véritable ou entièrement en acier:

Nous avons créé une application extrêmement facile à utiliser et exclusive pour aller avec le Foxter Exalt. Vous pouvez télécharger l'application depuis Google Play ou l'App Store, puis connecter votre montre à l'application. Enfin, configurez la montre pour répondre à tous vos besoins.

Vous pourrez alors bénéficier de toutes les fonctions et fonctionnalités de l'application:

- Activer / désactiver la fonction connectée en un seul clic
- Définir vos objectifs d'exercice et surveiller votre performance
- Sélectionnez les alertes que vous recevrez. Par exemple, si vous êtes en vacances, vous pouvez activer uniquement la fonction d'avis d'appel.

Et puis obtenir le meilleur de votre montre!

 

 

Garantie:
Tous nos produits ont une garantie de deux ans sur les pièces et la main-d'œuvre, sous réserve que la montre soit utilisée normalement

Livraison:
Nous pouvons livrer votre commande partout dans le monde. Puisque nous sommes une entreprise française, nos montres sont expédiées de Paris.
Les frais d'expédition que nous facturons dépendent de l'emplacement de l'adresse de livraison. Nous facturons le même coût pour 1 à 3 montres par commande. Les frais de port pour 5 à 9 montres par commande sont gratuits.
Les frais de port sont les suivants:
Europe: 25 €
USA et Canada: 35 €
Amérique du Sud: 35 €
Afrique: 35 €
Asie et Russie: 35 €
Océanie: 35 €

Nos montres hybrides FOXTER Exalt sont prêtes à livrer comme vous pouvez le voir:




 

En cas de commande, le choix de votre modèle se fera après avoir procédé au règlement. Vous recevrez un email de la part de FOXTER Watches vous permettant de choisir quel(s) modèle(s) vous souhaitez acquérir.

Taxes


Si vous résidez à l'extérieur de l'Union européenne, il peut y avoir des taxes à payer à votre gouvernement lorsque votre commande franchit la frontière.
Pour plus d'informations à ce sujet, nous vous suggérons de contacter votre bureau de douane local.

 

Retrouvez la version française

plus bas sur cette page

What can you do with a FOXTER Exalt: 

 

 

 

 

The project began with a very simple idea: a watch should not just be an object which tells the time. For a man, it is also an luxury accessory reflecting taste and personality, an item of jewellery to be displayed. What does this mean for those LED screen connected watches that flourish today, on which the user have to shake the arm to get the time, designed by people who have yet to understand that a black screen far from aesthetic.

 

 
So we have created the first premium hybrid watch: This is a real watch, with its own beating heart, a real screen and real hands instead of ugly LED screen we are encountering on Smartwatches. This timepiece is designed by a genuine watch-maker from the famous "place Vendome".
But this watch can tell more than just the time: A call, a message, the location of your smartphone and much more. Stay informed.... but with discretion!

First quality material

This is an exceptional object designed by a watchmaker from the famous "place Vendome". Indeed, the FOXTER Exalt was given birth in France, in Paris specifically.
We have chosen the best possible components, made from the most resistant materials, offering you the ultimate in comfort and ease of use, along with the latest innovations.

As a technological jewel, we have opted to assemble in Asia, where its software functions were also developed. We felt it was best to ensure that it was assembled near to those who developed its functions such that they could be perfectly configured.

FOXTER Exalt is in EDITION LIMITED and numbered to 2000 units.

Just as we completed the first prototypes of the FOXTER Exalt, our project was selected by the french government for its innovative qualities. As a result we participated in the Las Vegas CES in January 2017, in the French Tech pavilion where we were able to present the prototype of our watch to potential buyers.

 

Since our Exalt model was presented at the Las Vegas CES, more then 25,000 people have joined our Facebook community. We regularly post photos and videos to about the project's progress for our fans. So join us on our social media pages!

 

Press:

 

 

 

Quite before being a connected object, the FOXTER Exalt watch has been developed in with solemn respect for the purest watch-making traditions. It is quite naturally the result of a quest for the aesthetically sublime.
The watch's DNA is profoundly charged with this aesthetic foundation; the very origin of the project.


 

 

We are proposing 6 different bracelets depending of your envy. You will find below each of them. There are real and 100% leather or steel:

We have created a childishly easy to use and exclusive app to go with the Foxter Exalt. You can download the app from Google Play or the App Store, and then link your watch to the app and then configure the watch to suit your every need.

You will then be able to benefit from all of the app's functions and features:

- Activate/deactivate the connected function with just one click
- Define your exercise goals and monitor your performance
- Select the alerts that you will receive. For example, if you are on holiday, you can activate just the call notice function.

And then get the best of your watch!

 

 

 

 

Warranty

All of our products have a two-year parts and labour warranty, subject to the watch being used normally

Delivery

We can deliver your order to anywhere in the world. Since we are a French business, our watches are dispatched from Paris.
The shipping costs we charge depend on the location of the delivery address.We are charging same cost for 1 to 3 watches per order. Shipping cost for 5 to 9 watches per order are free of charge.
Shipping costs are as follows:
Europe: 25 €
USA and Canada: 35 €
South America: 35 €
Africa: 35 €
Asia and Russia: 35 €
Oceania: 35 €

Our FOXTER Exalt hybrid watches are ready to deliver as you can see:


 

Taxes

If you reside outside of the European Union, there may be custom's duty to pay to your government when your order crosses the frontier.
For more information about this, we suggest that you contact your local customs office.

As a result we participated in the Las Vegas CES in January 2017, in the French Tech pavilion where we were able to present the prototype of our watch to potential buyers. Since our Exalt model was presented at the Las Vegas CES, more then 25,000 people have joined our Facebook community. We regularly post photos and videos to about the project's progress for our fans. So join us on our social media pages! Press:   Quite before being a connected object, the FOXTER Exalt watch has been developed in with solemn respect for the purest watch-making traditions. It is quite naturally the result of a quest for the aesthetically sublime.The watch's DNA is profoundly charged with this aesthetic foundation; the very origin of the project.  We are proposing 6 different bracelets depending of your envy. You will find below each of them. There are real and 100% leather or steel:We have created a childishly easy to use and exclusive app to go with the Foxter Exalt. You can download the app from Google Play or the App Store, and then link your watch to the app and then configure the watch to suit your every need.You will then be able to benefit from all of the app's functions and features:- Activate/deactivate the connected function with just one click- Define your exercise goals and monitor your performance- Select the alerts that you will receive. For example, if you are on holiday, you can activate just the call notice function.And then get the best of your watch!    WarrantyAll of our products have a two-year parts and labour warranty, subject to the watch being used normallyDeliveryWe can deliver your order to anywhere in the world. Since we are a French business, our watches are dispatched from Paris.The shipping costs we charge depend on the location of the delivery address.We are charging same cost for 1 to 3 watches per order. Shipping cost for 5 to 9 watches per order are free of charge.Shipping costs are as follows:Europe: 25 €USA and Canada: 35 €South America: 35 €Africa: 35 €Asia and Russia: 35 €Oceania: 35 €Our FOXTER Exalt hybrid watches are ready to deliver as you can see: TaxesIf you reside outside of the European Union, there may be custom's duty to pay to your government when your order crosses the frontier.For more information about this, we suggest that you contact your local customs office.

story:
CODA Wallet - is a thin, compact, wallet made of high quality, genuine leather. We took everything good from the classical wallet design and made it minimalistic and more comfortable to use. All of the compartments are made with our knowledge of ergonomics so that it is comfortable and easy to use. The CODA wallet includes one large compartment for cash that can fit US dollars, CAD, AUD, EUR and other types of notes, two pockets for notes that can fit up to 3 cards each and two side compartments that can fit your documents, cards or bills. 


Dimensions: 4.1'' x 3.8'' x 0.5'' (105mm x 95mm x 15mm)

CODA Wallet will fit into the pocket of your favorite jacket or jeans

 

As an addition, we made a set of matching products which include a small compact card holder and a keychain.

Want to travel lightly?

Our card holder can be a good alternative. It can be handy at festivals, concerts, hiking, or on a Sunday morning bike ride.  

The compact card holder is made in the same style as the wallet and has 2 compartments which can fit over 6 cards + cash. 

 Dimensions: 2.8'' x 4'' (70mm x 100mm)

 

Empty CODA wallet and compact card holder with 6 cards and cash

 

CODA Wallet and compact card holder in green color

 

Our handmade leather keychain is 3.5inches (90mm) long and has a 1.2inch (30mm) diameter with a stainless steel ring.

 

We can add your initials on any of your rewards. Add $3 to your reward for 1 piece and add +$1 for each additional item.

 

 Choose the desired location for your initials. Use the numbers to let us know the location in the survey when the campaign ends.

 

Leather

We use a high quality, full grain leather that is named "Crazy Horse". Crazy horse leather doesn’t actually come from horses. The name was given due to its frequent and popular use in quality horse saddles.  

Crazy horse leathers are made by applying a special kind of wax to the leathers surface that has been buffed and smoothed out. This type of leather is showing it's beautiful aging over time and even in a month of use it will be as unique as it's owner.  

The more you use it, the better it look!

 

Colors

After the end of the campaign we will send you a survey where you will be able to choose colors of your wallets, card holders and keychains. 
We can suggest you 5 colors: black, brown, red brown, green and camel.

Shipping details

After the Indiegogo campaign, a survey will be sent where you will be able to provide your mailing address, choice of colors and other details. The early birds will be shipped out during September. Usually, shipping takes from 2 weeks for Europe, from 3 weeks for USA and Canada, and from 4 weeks for Australia and other countries. Sometimes it takes little more. After the shipping we will send you the tracking number of your package.

 

Risks and challenges

With our great experience from the previous campaign, we have fine tuned our production and packing methods. We've have reliable suppliers and are confident in making all of these products in the greatest quality. 
There could be postal delays that are out of our control depending on your postal service, however, we are giving you our pledge that each backer will get their reward.

story:
GroovePill.com just another online store, or is it? What journeys are worth supporting?

About Craig

The founder of GroovePill.com has had a long association with the apparel & fashion industry and is more than aware of the industry challenges & pitfalls. 

He started working on a business model that would remove the complexity & risk associated with the design, manufacture & supply of garment, thus GroovePill.com became a glint of a dream. 

Watching the video, you will learn that this concept came about first and foremost to assist others in a world where only the loudest are heard, we give a voice to those that are talented but lack the knowhow & support to self promote & grow.

As a father of four, I often think about their futures and who will give my kids a hand up in their chosen passion, it somewhat scares me!

The thought of my idea coming to fruition and adding value to the hopes and dreams of international talent fills me with an optimistic outlook for the arts and self expression.

Why The Arts?

  • The joy creativity brings to the world can be truly uplifting and inspiring.
  • In todays complex world, art might be the most honest news source.
  • Like dance, we need to appreciate the talent & dedication needed to perfect their craft.
  • Artists are some of the most inclusive beings on the planet.
  • As my end game is to grow a platform focused on supporting charities internationally, artists through their struggle for self growth, understand the importance of charity.

Now You!

I can not begin to tell you how invaluable your support would be, not just for me but for the millions of talented individuals that would benefit directly from what you and I will create, not to mention the charities. 

Quality                                                                                                                                                                   Through the diversity of range and popularity, it might hopefully highlight the need for retailers to use natural chemical free fibres in the manufacture of apparel as opposed to the harsh treatment of clothing currently littering our landfill and placed over our skin.                                                                      

In most cases, the privilege of natural fibres, quality print and a limited addition style print or embellishment comes with a hefty price tag, with GroovePill.com this is not the case

What We Need & What You Get                                                                                                                           We are looking to raise $14290. in funding. Every cent raised will be directed at GroovePill.com, every cent!

  • The funds will be used to create the website & associated platforms enabling social media and other functionality.
  • To make sure that once the site is live, it is SEO optimised and visually present.
  • We have already arranged alliances with a number of educational facilities globally to have their students get involved, the correspondence to some areas that have computers but no internet (Africa) needs USB support and postal services (this is part of our inclusion philosophy - no barriers).
  • Our I.P needs to be protected, which comes at a cost.
  • Our initial garments pre production will need to be paid.

If you see it within yourself to contribute to our cause, you will be rewarded with both a heartfelt thank you and based on level of support, rewards vary.

The Impact                                                                                                                                                             Having spent many years, supporting, developing and encouraging the artistic within the apparel and related industries, I know firsthand the reality of the industry.

  • Creatives are rewarded for their work but certainly not comparable to how much their work generates for the apparel industry, we will tip that scale to better support the artist.
  • The artist in most cases looses ownership of their artwork, not with us.
  • The more natural fibre garment you support, the less environmentally degrading garments will be sold (our wish)
  • Urgently needed funds will be sent to Charities around the world based on our sales.
  • We aim to make quality produced garments at affordable prices.

Risks & Challenges                                                                                                                                                    We have many years worth of experience developing brands and people both online and off. Craig has the experience to deal with both the hurdles and pitfalls within product development and  production through to import and distribution.

If we do not achieve our total target but achieve our biggest hurdle being the website development, we will still go ahead, it will just slow our ability to gain traction as quickly as we would prefer.

Other Ways You Can Help                                                                                                                                      We get that some people would love to take part however right now financial support is not an option, we get that; you can still help.

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • You can simply use the Indiegogo share tools or send them to www.GroovePill.com

Thank you agin for taking the time, care and joining in on our journey.

Craig has the experience to deal with both the hurdles and pitfalls within product development and  production through to import and distribution.

Other Ways You Can Help                                                                                                                                      We get that some people would love to take part however right now financial support is not an option, we get that; you can still help.

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
You can simply use the Indiegogo share tools or send them to www.GroovePill.com


Thank you agin for taking the time, care and joining in on our journey.

story:
Going with the Flow

Fascin8 Flow Wear is a brand inspired by the concepts of synchronicity and flow. Sometimes referred to in positive psychology as "being in the zone", flow is characterized as the mental state of full immersion, focus, and (most importantly) enjoyment of life. Flow is the achievement of a blissful state of being, punctuated by the feeling of effortlessness. Take a close look at our logo and you may find a few hints at these concepts incorporated into the design.

Flow = Comfort

At Fascin8, we believe a key component of flow is comfort. When we are comfortable and unencumbered by restrictive apparel, everything else seems to simply fall into place. There's something irresistible about the super soft T-shirt you find yourself reaching for every time you open the drawer. By using the softest, lightest and most luxurious fabrics, we give our customers a unique wearing experience unparalleled by any other clothing brands. We're on a mission to become your favorite T-shirt!

Flow = Sustainability

Of course, all of the comfort in the world is meaningless if the manufacturing process required to achieve it wreaks havoc on the environment. With this in mind, we felt it equally important to ensure our clothing is made using the most sustainable fabrics and manufacturing techniques available. 

The four fabric types we currently incorporate into our product line include certified organic cotton, naturally organic hemp, and bamboo as well as RPET Polyesters. The first three are sustainable organics that minimize water consumption and avoid the use of harsh pesticides and fertilizers in their cultivation. The fourth is a synthetic polyester which is actually sourced by recycling discarded plastic bottles thereby diverting waste plastics from oceans and landfills.

We only use low impact, fiber reactive dyes that are not harmful to the environment. This means our dyes do not contain any heavy metals or toxic substances. Recycled water is used in the dye facilities as well to minimize the amount of fresh water needed when compared with all other dye processes in the industry.

           

Flow = Philanthropy

At the very core of Fascin8 Flow Wear, we believe a crucial component of our success will be investing in positivity by giving a portion of our profits back to worthy non-profit/charitable beneficiaries who align with our ethos. As such, we pledge a percentage of all future profits will be donated to organizations devoted to humanitarian efforts and/or cleaning and sustaining our environment for future generations. As a customer of Fascin8 Flow Wear, you can take pride in knowing that a portion of the money you spend with us will be "recycled" back into the community.

Note: Interested registered 501(c)(3) organizations can contact us directly at info@fascin8fw.com to apply for support.

 

              

 

Fascin8 Future State

Every great success has grown from humble beginnings. At Fascin8 Flow Wear, we have purposely kept things simple as we work through our own "humble beginnings". However, one of our more ambitious goals for the future will be to use our brand as a platform for launching and supporting small, independent artists. Our eco-friendly clothing makes a perfect canvas ready for embellishment with amazing works of art. Keep an eye out in the future for Fascin8ing design themes and limited edition artwork!!! 

 

​What We Need & What You Get

Our starting goal is to raise $20,000.  These funds will be put towards the development of our web store, building our starting inventory, and helping create our mobile vendor store to travel to festivals and events to help sell and spread the word about our amazing products. We don't believe in getting something for nothing, so we've created a perks list which will allow our contributors to become some of our very first customers. 

Your contribution will move us one step closer to our goal of being an industry leader in casual, eco-friendly clothing. We endeavor to create a model which will set a standard for environmental alignment in the for-profit sector. We seek to serve as an example for companies across all industries to demonstrate a progression towards an era where altruism and environmental entrepreneurship will dominate the economic landscape. 

     

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand  some people just aren't in a position to contribute to a campaign financially. Fortunately, in this day and age, it doesn't mean that you can't help. If you've gotten this far we hope you will take a moment to use your social media platforms and some of the tools built into this campaign program to help us spread the word. You can still make a difference and help increase our audience with a few simple clicks of a button.  As always, we're extremely grateful to all those who support us!!!!
